description:
Absolutely amazing. The ramen was perfection. Went with the family and everything was good and having the waitlist option is amazing because you know when you will be up. I had the spicy miso ramen and I wanted more and more. 

Hot sake was delicious and we also ordered the chicken teriyaki, and salmon teriyaki. Yummy yummy! Can't wait to go back.
author: Alex A.

description:
Not really Japanese. I am used to Non-Japanese owned Japanese restaurant by now but I really did not like their mediocre ramen (Don't ask me why but I visited Fumi for 3 times). I am almost sure it is not 100% house made (probably they use / add pre-made soup base). Their Curry is OK especially with the Katsu, but nor really worth the visit.   

Fumi - please use correct Japanese on your menu. I will help you if you like.
author: Chie J.

description:
Fumi is a great affordable place to have a quick Japanese dinner with friends or a significant other. The lighting is dim with a cozy ambiance. 

The menu has lots of options. We got the Chicken Katsu with Spicy Curry, Shrimp Tempura with Spicy Curry and the Chicken Teriyaki. The curry dishes all come with lots of curry and not enough rice/protein. Definitely order more rice or an extra side of protein with your order because the plates are large and swimming in curry. In addition, each order comes with a side of salad. 

The Katsu is fried nicely and does not give off that frozen chicken taste. The tempura was nothing special so I would not recommend ordering that with a curry dish. The Chicken Teriyaki was fresh and also not frozen. It was juicy and not dry.
author: Karen Y.

description:
I was craving curry and my friend was craving ramen so we decided to give Fumi another try. After looking at the menu, I decided to get the teppan chicken katsu curry and my friend got the spicy miso pork belly ramen. 

The food came out super fast! The curry came out on a sizzling plate consisting of a thin layer of egg, topped with rice, topped with the chicken katsu on top, then the waitress pours some curry on top. This dish was alright, I've had better curry elsewhere, but the chicken was the star of the dish! It was very tender and fried perfectly! The ramen was okay as well. Nothing too special imo. 

Overall this place was alright, I would go again if I was in the area, but not trek all the way to the mission for this.
author: Stacey Y.

description:
I've been to Fumi a couple of times now. On my most recent visit, I came on a Sunday afternoon and was able to get a table right away. My friend ordered the Chicken Katsu Teppan Curry and I ordered the Spicy Miso Pork Belly Ramen.

The Spicy Miso Pork Belly Ramen was decent. The broth had a little kick to it and the pork belly was alright. I did wish there were a little more noodles though. Nothing too memorable but if you are craving ramen, the ramen here might hit the spot. 

The Chicken Katsu Teppan Curry was also decent. The katsu was crispy but it did get soggy pretty fast. The curry flavor was good, but nothing that special to me. I did like the presentation though. The katsu came with rice and eggs and the server poured the curry around the hot teppan when the dish arrived. 

Overall an okay spot to grab a bite to eat if you are in the area.
author: Michael L.

description:
The curry was decent here, not the best or the most interesting, but it was a really enjoyable experience cause of how it looked on the plate.

I got the grill plate thing they were doing for the tonkatsu curry rice, and overall the dish was pretty good. The curry itself wasn't anything special, it tasted about the same quality as what you would get from a curry box, so I don't give it many points there.

But by putting onto the grill (with the egg around it), it kept the curry reasonable warm, and everything else on the place was done quite well that overall the dish was enjoyable, especially given that I'm in San Francisco and the options are limited.

They do have quite a few vegan options, my friend got one made of gobo and liked it.
author: Tyler T.

description:
Came here on a Friday evening with 3 other friends. We ordered the tako octopus balls and chicken karaage for
Appetizers. They were both delicious.  I've never seen the tako balls on 
The menu so had to order. We also had two large bottles of beer. Their prices for beer and sake is really reasonable!  I ordered the fish katsu teppan curry with egg. I loved how they poured my spicy curry on the platter and my plate just sizzled!  And spicy curry is not too spicy. The waitress said it was really medium. The rice Actually got a crispy crust on the bottom. It was yummy. My husband ordered the hamburger teppan curry.  The Hamburger wasn't as good as my fish. My friend got the tonkatsu broth ramen with chicken Katsu. She enjoyed her dish a lot and also added on pork belly. 

TIP:  for dessert we opted to walk over to Mitchell's for ice cream.
author: Donna L.

description:
Third time here, and I've been very happy with my experience each time! Whenever I come here with my boyfriend, it's usually never crowded. We're able to be seated right away. The atmosphere is very modern. The only complaint I have is that the tables are really close together so you don't get too much privacy, but it doesn't bother me too too much.

I've gotten the teppan chicken katsu curry, the tender chicken curry rice, and their ramen and you really can't go wrong with any of these! I usually get the regular spicy for curry and it's not spicy at all, so don't worry if you're a spice wimp like me. The curry is always really comforting and hits the spot. I make my own ramen bowl with the tonkatsu broth and chasu. The broth is very light, not too heavy like some other ramen places I've been to, so I never feel too heavy and weighed down after finishing my bowl. 

Overall, I'd definitely recommend this place if you're craving some bomb Japanese food! I'm excited to come back and try their omurice next!
author: Amberly H.

description: Nice Japanese style restaurant to have a hearty bowl of delicious ramen or a crispy pork cutlet in a thick curry sauce. The ramen noodles were nice and tender, and the broth flavorful. I loved the fresh ingredients including veggies, bamboo shoots, and half an egg. My friend enjoyed her pork cutlet. Next time I'll come back to order the pork cutlet. Also, great customer service!
author: Joanne K.

description:
Was in the mood for ramen and Fumi was open and could do takeout.
Located right on 29th. The inside decor was sparse but ok, see pictures. There is seating inside.

The menu has plenty of options, and even within categories like ramen there are many to choose from.

The person that took the order was very patient and friendly. 

I order some gyoza $7, edamame $5, chicken teriyaki, $12.50 and 4 ramen dishes, including chicken, chicken katsu, pork katsu, and pork chashu each about $12.50. total about $80 and fed 6 easily with some leftover.

The edamame was just like edamame ordered anywhere else, good, but nothing memorable. I didn't try the gyoza but everyone else liked them. 

The chicken katsu ramen and chicken ramen were good, nice flavor, I like the toppings with green onions, corn, etc. but the ramen and pork broth were just ok, but not bad. They were prepared ok but nothing spectacular.

The chicken teriyaki was ok, tasted nice, but just like chicken teriyaki you could get anywhere else.

The food was fine, helpful cashier, so 3 stars.
author: Keith A.

description:
Dish: Pork Katsu Teppan Curry
Cost: $13.50
Dish Rating: 4.25/5
Review: I love Japanese curry  I've only had a handful of Japanese curry spots in SF and I must say I was surprised by this spot. The curry is good, but the pork katsu stayed consistently crispy even after the sauce was on it for so long! Normally it gets soggy at other places so quickly but this pork katsu held its own well  I wish it was a little more moist and tender tho. The curry itself usually tastes the same to me everywhere I go (if they're good) so this one didn't really differ too much from other good spots. This came on a sizzling platter which was cool! It's a little out of the way for me to travel to, but if I'm ever in the area I'll definitely come back! They have so many things on the menu I wanted to try! (Ramennnnn!) Came here on a Wednesday night around 5:30pm and there was no wait  we were there for 2 hours and during that time a lot of diners came in, but no wait. Parking isn't too difficult around this area as well.
author: Valerie T.

description:
I came here on a Hinge date so I didn't take any pictures but I wish I did! 

When you get to Fumi go straight to the pad on the wall on the right side across from the bar and check-in! There's most likely a line and the line may include people waiting in the back (there's a back room.)

All regular ramen bowls come with bean sprouts, bamboo shoots, kikurage mushrooms, sweet corn, spinach, and green onion. 

The teppan curry ramen dishes came with different toppings according to which dish it was. I tried the chashu teppan curry ramen because I hadn't seen it at most ramen places in the Bay Area, but was also eyeing the chicken curry ramen. It came with roasted pork (yum! Not too fatty, which I like), bean sprouts, sweet corn, bamboo shoots, and an onion sunny-side egg. 

The egg was delicious! Very runny. The broth was rich and warm, and noodles were just the right amount of chewy. 

It was a good-sized portion for $14.95. I didn't finish the bowl and I was hungry from waiting to be seated for so long! (It was probably over half an hour, but it was after 8 soooo.) 

My date gets the same meal each time he goes to Fumi: seafood with black curry omurice (Japanese omelette with curry and fried rice inside.) I tried some and it was really good, but beware--the black curry will stain your teeth! 

Fumi also has lots of tea drinks, like crazy macha milk tea, sexy strawberry milk tea, creamy taro milk tea, beautiful Thai milk tea, and love fumi milk tea (you can add boba to all of them!) but I'm not a fan of having to pay $1 for hot brown rice tea. I think it should be included! 

They have a pretty good dessert menu including green tea cheesecake, mango mousse, tiramisu, Mochi, and regular ice cream. 

If you're in the Mission, check out Fumi for top-notch ramen and curry plates!
author: Lizzie S.

description:
I am usually not a huge curry fan, but I was surprised to have really enjoyed my experience at Fumi! The restaurant is very small and can be easily overlooked. We came on a Friday night at around 7pm and we were luckily able to get a seat without waiting. 

I decided on their fish katsu teppanyaki, which came on a hot stone plate with a side of curry. I chose to add spice, which ended up not being spicy at all for those who enjoy spicy food. The plate came to the table boiling and hot, and the waitress poured the curry on top. It came with a ring of egg as well, and they gave a generous portion of katsu. I really enjoyed the fish katsu! It was very moist and the flaky crisp of the fish was perfectly fried. I also liked the griddles rice from the hot stone pot, which really elevated the whole dish to a new level. 

Overall, I would definitely recommend this place. I would probably come back next time to try the soft shell crab shoyu ramen.
author: Sandra S.

description:
From the exterior to the interior and the menu, Fumi gives me a good first impression of how modest this dining place is!  

It is not too busy here on a weekday during lunch hour, we got seated right away and food was being served less than 15 mins after the order was taken.  We ordered a chashu teppan curry and a Katsu curry.  Generous portion. Quality curry with good looooking!  I guess this is all I look for in this place :) 

Very satisfied and I believe I will be back!

Pro: One of the highlights is their menu, which is very cartoony and easy to comprehend! I like it a lot! 

Con: Spent a while to look for parking! If you don't mind walking for a couple blocks than paying for meters, you may park at the residential areas :)
author: Shuyi L.

description:
We went there on a Sunday afternoon. There was no line. And super easy to find a street parking.  The pork curry was definitely better than the soft crab ramen. The katsu was perfectly cooked. 
Compare my soft crab ramen photo to other photos. Yep.. missing my fav woodear mushrooms. If they didn't forget the mushrooms, I would have given a four star.  Make sure to check your bowl.
author: Rachael C.

description:
The food here was good, buuuut....
Service absolutely matters to me.  Hence the 3 star rating. 

I came as a party of four and was third to last from ordering. I ordered the tonkatsu broth with chasu inside and my bf who ordered after me asked for the same. Okay, all is fine and well. Servers leaves, we catch up with our friends. 


When 2/4 bowls of ramen arrive..another server tried to give us the tan tan men. We politely declined and said that wasn't what we ordered. The lady left and we thought the situation was handled.  The first lady who took our order down then comes back to our table with the same ramen and says that was what we ordered. I again tell her I ordered tonkatsu with chasu and my bf also agrees that was what he ordered as well. She leaves and I think they'll just correct the order but NO. This lady comes back to our table again and brings her notepad telling us we ordered the tan tan men. She was already super aggressive the first time but this time she basically told me what I ordered. My other two friends also jumped in to say we all heard us order TONKATSU. Come on, lady! It was poor customer service and she was so aggressive in handling us. 

When our food came, I'll admit that it was pretty good...but sadly the experience left a bad taste in my mouth already.
author: Emily C.

description:
Easily one of my new favorite restaurants! My friend brought me here finally, after raving about this for months. It's one of her favorite places to eat and now I understand why.

I ordered the shrimp tempan curry dish, and it comes out piping hot on a pan. When the server pours the curry (you can ask her for a specific level of spice) over the egg, it starts sizzling. The curry is a tad bit sweet, and spice is concentrated on the bottom, so mix! But as your food sits on the plate, the egg and rice becomes crispy, and stays hot. Yum!!! And the shrimps are battered in panko (not tempura), but crispy to perfection. I'd definitely come back and order again. 

Also! They have "every green" and vegetarian options on almost all dishes, so options for folks! They have ramen, sushi, and curry for all my friends who wants a place with a variety of food.
author: Melody W.

description: My favorite local ramen place.  Service is friendly and quick.  I love their ramen but also love the sizzling curry dishes.  Great atmosphere with a great mix of clientele
author: Paul S.

description:
Such a cute little restaurant with delicious food! They used to serve more food here but now they only focus on ramen and curry. 

I ordered the tongkotsu ramen with chashu pork, and it was very delicious. My girlfriend ordered the chicken katsu with curry and she loved it as well. I would recommend both. 

The shop itself was small with a few tables and a bar, in which you could choose where to sit. I would definitely come back here again now that I live here (:
author: Phi V.

description:
It was 11am and like always, nothing went according to plan. We arrived at the "planned" restaurant and realized they were not open til 5:30pm, silly me. 

We were all hangary and frantically looked up this place. Walked in and noticed this guy eating curry over rice! Oh WOW it looked delicious! The entire table ordered chicken katsu, how unoriginal right? But, we all loved it!

For the spice level, mild does not have much of a kick to it. I suggest going one up on spice! Service was alright, they seem to have only one waitress on a Sat morning waiting tables and taking phone orders.
author: Shirley F.

description: The curry here is outstanding- whether ramen or rice plate... DAMN. My partner said it's the best Japanese ramen he's had. I thought it was delicious I'll definitely be coming back!!
author: Nas M.

description:
I always wanted to go here when I lived here, but never had the chance. Now that I'm here visiting and staying at an Airbnb close by I got it delivered! The food got to me 20 mins later than expected through GrubHub, but it was piping hot so therefore I cannot complain.

I got the Pork Katsu Curry extra spicy...
- The pork was juicy and not fatty, perfectly crispy
- Huge portion of rice
- Large portion of salad
- Curry was sent in a separate container (thank goodness) and it was hot with the right kick, but it could be spicier. I would also say the portion of curry is much more than Volcano or Muracci's, so I was thoroughly impressed!

That meal gave me dinner and lunch so be ready for big portions. I'll be back again and hope to update this review with an in-person experience. Overall the food was awesome and highly recommend for delivery!
author: Jackie O.

description:
Ordered the vegetarian curry ramen, added side of garlic topping.

The veggie curry was pretty intense and quite flavorful, certainly tasty. It became kind of a lot of the same intense curry-ness after a while of eating though. The ramen noodles were just absolutely cooked perfectly, and had that nice chew. Oh, I was disappointed that the side of garlic was the roasted, almost burnt garlic, I was expecting fresh garlic. :/ 


I would probably go back to order the veggie meat tempura curry thing next time, that looked good, cuz I love the fake meat soy stuff. I might order the veggie curry noodles again.
author: Shruti D.

description:
Ordered:

Potato Croquet
Veg Tempura
Teppan Curry Ramen (ever green) 

All Vegetarian. The food was great and enjoyed every bite. 

Will visit again to try their Soup Ramen.
author: Prateek R.

description:
Wow. Feedmi some Fumi. 

Their chicken teppan curry was pretty good but also familiar. Reminded me of the japanese curry at Volcano in richmond. However, unlike Volcano, the rice/curry is served in a moat of egg and there were no veggies. The meats were alright and nothing special but there was a fair amount in proportion to the rice served. Speaking of, the bottom of the rice becomes crispy towards the end and that was probably the best part of this whole ordeal besides the sizzling curry. 

I'm excited to try their noodles next time--looks very filling. The spicy sauce condiment on the table is probably what they use to spice their noodles so use that to adjust if you want more spice level!

Other tidbits: parking in this area is hard to find as the street has mostly bars, service was good, was seated immediately at 9pm on a saturday, and the takoyaki balls were kind of small.
author: Lydia Z.

description:
Great service, great variety of dishes, Especially the only mushroom Ramen I have heard of.
Liked the chicken karrage & edamame but especially the hamachi carpaccio! I usually order this as an appetizer and share it because it's not enough as a meal.
author: Elpie K.

description: I ordered from grubhub again and they were fast.  Mainly I wanted boba drinks, but I wanted some good quality snacks or food.  They still have great ramen soups. I ordered their Chashu Ramen with an added pork belly. They separate their sooo tasty still hot broth from the bowl of noodles, veggies, meat.  Once you combine them, they are a great fresh combination from the bamboo shoots to the half boiled egg to the meat & noodles.  Their taro boba, matcha latte(iced), and thai boba drinks are all great.  Their chashu ramen at $16 (since I ordered the pork belly adding $3 to it) was pricey, but well-deserved for such well prepared, tasty, fresh food.
author: Frugal C.

description: My husband and two other friends decided to try this place out after seeing a few other friends go to this place. It is a very small restaurant in the Mission. We were seated right away on a weekend but it varies on what time you arrive you may have to wait. For starters we ordered the Kakuni, garlic broccoli, fried squid legs and soft shell crab. The broccoli was made simple pretty much cooked in garlic with I believe sesame oil so really couldn't go wrong with a veggie dish but not sure how I feel paying $6 for a small plate of it. The Kakuni was alright as well, it was basically pork belly in soy sauce I wasn't too excited about it. I liked the fried squid legs, it was not too chewy or fishy tasting. The soft shell crab was too battered or fried so it was not to my liking. For our entrees we each ordered a teppan with curry as follows: steak rep-an, hamburger teppan, pork teppan and ground pro teppan ramen. The food came out pretty quick considering the waiter told us that the kitchen was a bit behind. All curries came out on a hot sizzling pan and you pour the curry onto it. I thought the curry was alright, I asked for mild spicy, while everyone else had ordered spicy and it was not as spicy as they thought.  Each teppan, came with an egg as well. All in all I thought the food was ok, I was not too excited about the curry even though its pretty popular here. I want to say service was great, I would recommend to try it at least once if you like it great if not, move on. For the most part parking is hard on the mission so come a time you think its not as busy , since there are many other surround restraints in the area.
author: Tiffany K.

description: Had a craving for some ramen and Fumi hit the spot. I had the Chicken Katsu ramen with the pork broth. The Katsu came on the side and the ramen came with bean sprouts, bamboo and corn. For an extra $2 I added two slices of chasu (pork). Omgeee so savory and flavorful. Hubby had the seafood ramen and it came packed with fish, mussels and clams. We ordered take out and the ramen, broth and Katsu were packed separately.
author: Mai N.

description:
YOU MUST go for the teppan curry over the orginal curry plate!  There's a miles difference.

Proceeding onto the pork katsu teppan curry.

The sizzling cast iron plate brings out the flavor of the curry and enriches it.  There's definitely something soothing about eating food that's hot and ready.  I was delighted to find that the heat produced a beautifully crisp bottom layer of rice!  Cooking around the rice, you'll find a light fluffy layer of egg to pair each bite with.

I substituted for the black curry because why not?  I was curious how it tasted.  The color black comes from the infusion of squid ink btw.  So don't worry, it's not poison (:  I enjoyed the multiple spices of the sauce that gave it a nice kick.  Extra spicy wasn't too bad but beware of their homemade spice on the table, it's pretty intense !

The pork katsu was nicely breaded and tender.   I was heavily on the edge about ordering the hamburger but thankfully my friend did instead.  It's unique because they use a mixture of ground beef AND pork.  I took a bite from my friend's and wow.  The meat is so soft you could probably eat it if you had no teeth.

Service was exceptional!  The weather and food was blazing hot yet the waitress never failed to continue quenching our thirst.  She probably served at least 5 rounds of water to my party of 11 #madprops
author: Derek L.

description: I love the curry here very much !! Friendly service! Clean restaurant!!! Absolutely delicious curry ! The best curry in San Francisco!! I had try the chashu teppan ramen ! The new teppan ramen on the menu also they have omurice !! Absolutely going next time !!
author: Agnes S.

description: DON'T BOTHER PUTTING YOUR NAME ON THE WAITLIST REMOTELY!  The live waitlist showed a 14-24 minute wait and we got there in 10 minutes.  The RUDE Chinese waitress said we already missed our call and would have to wait.  After asking how much longer, she said 10-15 minutes.  She then proceeded to seat two other tables in that time span and ignored us.  When I asked her again, she was only interested in knowing if we were leaving and didn't bother telling us she had a table leaving and that we'd be seated in a second.  WE LEFT WITHOUT EATING.  NOT WORTH THE WAIT - especially when they had a whole empty back section that they apparently didn't staff!
author: Bea Q.

description:
More of a 3.5 stars for me. Got lured in by their teppan curry from the pictures I saw on yelp. Came with my bf and we ordered the chicken katsu teppan curry and fried chicken teppan curry. 

The chicken for both was just eh-dible. We did enjoy the curry, but I just wished the curry was a little more rich. My favorite part of the teppan curry experience was the egg, and of course it's on a teppan. Love how you get the sizzling crispy rice after. 
Be careful as it is super hot. I ended up burning my tongue because I was too inpatient.

Overall, I love the concept, but the food didn't wow me. Might come back to try their ramen if I'm ever in the area. Too bad parking can be hard to find.
author: Wendy L.

description: I've eaten here twice for lunch.  First time I had the curry hamburger teppan rice.  Something was lacking, best part was the egg (on the bottom).  The pickles on the table helped a lot, I ate most of the jar!  Service was good, water glass always filled.  Second time, I had the tonkatsu ramen, broth was too salty.  Ramen had nice chew, chasu was tender and nicely flavored.  Service (different server) was so so, didn't check on us.  Was told their credit card machine not working and asked to pay cash.  Wiped out my wallet.
author: R K.

description:
We were in San Francisco for an appointment and it was time for lunch, we wandered around and wanted to go to the Peruvian restaurant but it did not open until 11:30. The time was 11:00 and we were very hungry. We looked on Yelp for an alternative restaurant, we saw Fumi Japanese Curry and Ramen!!! And it's open!!! We quickly walked there, and we were overwhelmed by the delicious smells inside!!!!! 

The menu has great selections!!! I chose Ramen with Curry Broth, with broccoli, gobo, and deep fried tofu. My fiancé ordered Salad, Karaage, Tempura. First to come out was a huge, beautifully arranged salad. We gobbled it up!!!! When my Ramen arrived my eyes and nose were very happy!!! The broth was savory and Curry-ee!!! It was delicious!!!!! Great amount of toppings too!!! This was so yummy, I was actually very quiet!!! I was totally into this Ramen!!!!!! I will definitely be back to try more items on their menu!!!!!!
author: Kitty-Chan I.

description: Food was pretty good. Order ramen and I guess they were close because the broth was still hot. Curry flavors we're good. We had take out so I imagine eating here would be even better. Fast, delicious, and decent portions.
author: Liz D.

description:
A gem

Pork Katsu Teppan Curry!!!!!!!
- let me preface that I've never really been a fan of Japanese curry,  having grown up with the more flavorful Thai and Indian curries,  but this curry was tasty on point!  I got it spicy,  but it gave a perfect amount of flavor,  savory,  a little tangy. It sizzles so nicely when poured on the iron plate and with no splatter at all!  The Katsu was perfectly crispy with a light layer of panko, great execution!  The egg layer around the rice was nice,  especially since it was separated from Katsu.  I've been unsatisfied with Katsu don before when the egg makes the Katsu soggy.  

Seafood curry ramen
-hella good as well and the noodles were good bouncy consistency! I felt like it was perfect recovery fluid for my friend who had a cold at the time

Service was friendly,  and thorough

Atmosphere was intimate,  as we were seated at the bar

Would definitely come here on a cold day next time!
author: Tina A.

description:
My friend invited me here and I was a little skeptical. First off, I've been to many ramen joints and the broth is either too salty, too bland, or too "porky" (if that makes sense? lol). Additionally, I didn't wanna smell like curry when we go grab some dessert afterwards.But hey...I was looking for an adventure and I didn't mind trying something new.

Boy, was I glad thst we tried it out. Appetizers were a hit or miss. Like the salad were ok. Tempura was good but nothing out of the ordinary. And the takoyaki were simple and prepared as they should be. Bottomline...the appetizers were ok.

As for the ramen........omg..............I didn't stop talking about how delicious it was. Bite after bite, I told my friend: This is realllllllyyyyy good. It was getting quite embarrassing as I couldn't stop saying it lol. I LOVE THE SOFT SHELL CRAB RAMEN!!!!! Please get it with the toasted garlic oil...it's worth the extra $1! So aromatic & so flavorful! Best ramen I've ever had!

My friend ordered the chicken katsu curry on a sizzling plate. It was a huge portion and was delcious as well! We kinda wished though that the server allowed us to pour how much sauce we wanted on the chicken. Make sure you request that to control how much sauce is placed on your entree.

Verdict? I will come back. In fact, it's 80 degrees today in SF but wouldn't mind going there tonight for dinner. It's THAT GOOD....trust me:)
author: Ralph N.

description:
Came here on a Saturday around lunch and surprisingly not that packed. The curry is phenomenal and has a really nice heat to it. We ordered the shrimp tempura curry rice and the teppan chicken katsu curry rice. The teppan is totally worth it because the hot plate adds a really nice crisp to the egg which gives a nice crunchy texture! Definitely don't miss out in that. 

Parking wasn't too hard to find because there are a lot of meters but there is a Safeway not too far so if you wanna buy something there and swing by after that works too.

I added pictures of the menu in case people are interested!
author: Augustus Y.

description: Just barely okay. Packaged noodles. Undercooked chashu. Very weak and thin (and salty!) "tonkatsu" broth. Very small portions. And very antagonistic proprietors. We (and another table) asked about their "black curry". They were unwilling to let anyone try it first. I asked for a common ramen condiment and they said they weren't sure they had it but never came back.  There are far better choices in town.
author: Anthony B.

description:
This is a great place to get your curry craving. Don't let the size of the shop fool you they actually have more tables in the back! Very cute and down to earth feel. I never had to wait for a table for the times I came. The waitresses are attentive and comes by so often to refill water.

I tried their Black Curry with Soft Shell Crab. It was delicious. The squid ink is just for aesethic if you want to take photos, but it DOES NOT affect with the taste. People might think it does only because your brain psychologically think so! I got their Katsu Teppan Curry too and that was great as well! Everything was seasoned well. I love the crispness of my sizzling egg. Their karagae is juices and crispy. They are great at frying their meats for sure ;)
author: Grace Z.

description:
It feels like places usually specialize in curry or ramen, but not both.  The curry was the clear proficiency here while the ramen was a kind of middle-of-the-road.  Definitely a unique find in a neighborhood filled with Latin American options.

Takoyaki: Tasty appetizer.  Like a doughy Munchkin® with octopus inside.  Great variety of texture and flavors.  

Tonkotsu Ramen: A little disappointing.  It looked the cloudy white part but didn't have anywhere near the richness of Ippudo.  Also, found the noodles to be a bit too big and chewy.  It'd be fine as a bowl of ramen where they don't really name the broth, but it is a letdown for the tonkotsu label.

Chicken Katsu: Perfectly crispy all around.  Thinly pounded meat to maximize fried surface area while still remaining moist.

Spicy Curry Sauce: I paid $4 extra for this side just so I could soak up my chicken katsu in this delicious sauce.  It seriously gives Marucci's a run for the money.  I was literally spooning it like soup, so good!
author: Adam B.

description:
3.5 stars

Get the pork katsu teppan curry over the other curry plates for the pour over curry visual and sizzling sound effects. It looks and sounds so amazing, you'll be drooling. 

Let's talk portions. My friend's regular beef curry was sparse in meat, and after he saw my sizzling plate presentation, I knew he instantly regretted his choice. His beef curry dish looked lonely compared to my mound of pork katsu. I shared mine with him of course :) 

Overall, I liked my dish. Don't eat too fast, because I burned the top of my mouth (my bad for my impatience). The egg and pork katsu combo was delicious, but I felt that the meat could be more tender. 

Card is accepted for transactions $10 or more. Service was great, and I would come back if the craving hits.
author: Corinna T.

description: Go to comfort food! I always get the hamburger sizzling plate (if you get the curry- make sure its teppan- that is a must!). Good amount of curry- sizzling hot- love the egg on the plate and the rice as it sizzles and gets crunchy over time. Only wish the patty was thicker- a little too thin in my opinion. Never tried the ramen- maybe one day. Yea- service is not the best, and there are Chinese workers? But curry is so good, I don't care!
author: Vivian D.

description:
With every bite, all I could say was.. "SOOOO GOOD." We waited about 30 minutes since it was table for 5. Any parties larger then 4, will be seated in the back and theres very limited seating, even more limited then the front. We had parties of 2s,3s, and 4s get seated before us. The wait is worth it but it's better to go in 2's. 

I tried the chicken katsu teppan curry and was blow away how delicious it was. Better believe that I ate the WHOLE thing.
author: Lisa L.

description: Came here and ordered the chicken katsu curry. The dish was fresh and crispy, being just the right texture for katsu. There was also a good amount of curry that went with the rice so that you don't have an overbearingly amount of curry left. Definitely would recommend based on the taste and portion size and freshness of the katsu.
author: Galen W.

description:
My favorite is their Curry Beef Patty sizzling plate! Just the right and generous size of the beef patty, rice, egg, and curry gravy is perfection! I like how you can adjust the level of spicy from low, medium to HIGH! I always order medium just to be in the safe zone. 

I come here quite often and have also tried their ramen. Their pork belly ramen simply just melts in your mouth like butter. 

Service is splendid, everyone is kind. Overall, marking this as one of my go-to places for brunch and dinner.
author: Johanna M.

description:
Everybody's saying to get the teppan curry but I didn't.. because I'm a rebel or something. I had the squid ink black curry with chicken katsu and my friend had a make-your-own ramen. The portions for both were good with both of us leaving bloated. 

The curry was good - though I'm not sure what the point of the squid ink is. It tasted the exact same as normal curry so the additional $2.50 was a bit of a hit for me. The menu had a great selection of entrées that I wanted to try them all. Service was prompt and patient.
author: Myles C.

description:
Surprised I'm writing a lackluster review because the ratings are high, but my family and I weren't fans of the food.

We ordered simple chicken teriyaki dishes (the kids like simple) and the dish was dry and overly salted. 

Would have been nice to have a little teriyaki sauce on the side to take away the salt and add moisture.

Had a few bites and then discarded. :(
author: Nenette Y.

description:
Got the teppan pork curry (spicy version) and takoyaki.

Takoyaki. stay away from. Not much flavor on the outside, expected more of the dashi flavor, less dough, and A LOT more octopus. Overall, just let me down. It also had square bottoms. Who does that?!?!

Teppan pork curry. That's where it's at. It's on a stone plate that's sizzling hot and there's a layer of rice in the middle and egg on the outskirts. Then the meat is placed on top of the rice. There's some curry they pour around the meat so that the pork katsu isn't drenched and is still crunchy (but there's a container that has curry sauce on the side). Some of the rice is extra crispy since it's on the stone and that was a nice touch. Definitely a very enjoyable experience and I would opt for this over the other curries.
author: Victor D.

description:
It's really a good place to have lunch!
Good quality!
And fast speed!
The waitress came to me right after i walked in. 
I ordered the kare kastu...... it came out in about 10mins and I can feel kastu was really fresh! And it taste good!

Definitely come next time!
author: Yantong Z.

description: My favorite vegetarian ramen!! The curry broth is so amazing. I always RAVE about this place to everyone
author: AnaMaria H.

description:
Fun idea to make the curry teppanyaki style. Get that camera ready as the waiter pours the sauce and the curry sizzles in your face. Unfortunately the chicken katsu was nothing amazing. I think the hot plate added a slight burnt flavor to the sauce, which I didn't prefer.

You can blacken your curry for $2.50 but I wouldn't recommend it. It tastes the same and all you'll get is black teeth.
author: Vans C.

description:
Came here on a weekday night around 6pm with le bf. We were seated right away in the area near the front of the restaurant. If the front looks full, there is also a back area where people were seated, so don't be discouraged right away if you see the front full. 

We ordered:
1. Soft shell crab appetizer ($12)
2. Mild Pork Katsu Teppan Curry ($13.50)
3. Spicy Chicken Katsu Teppan Curry ($13.50)

The soft shell crab appetizer came out very quickly. It came out hot and crunchy, just the way we like it. Though a bit pricey, we would both order it again. 

I ordered the pork katsu teppan curry and asked the lady who brought it to our table to not pour the curry, I wanted to do it myself. The portion was sizable, and I was shocked at how large the actual pork katsu was. Normally, at other restaurants, the pork katsu portion is very small. I thoroughly enjoyed my teppan curry. I also really loved how there was a mini jar of pickled daikon (?) at the table. I nearly finished the jar at our table. 

This was the second time that le bf has visited this restaurant. He knew exactly what he wanted and said that his spicy chicken katsu teppan curry came out perfectly, and exactly like the last time.

Overall, this place offers up some very tasty curry at a very reasonable price. The staff was also super friendly and attentive. We will definitely be coming back. They also served ramen which looked really good when we saw other tables ordering it. We may give the ramen a try next time.
author: Carolyn Z.

description:
Fumi is a total gem in the otherwise dull collection average restaurants in this part of the Mission. Come here for the curry and appetizers at lunch and the sashimi for dinner. Ramen is good, definitely better than its neighbor Coco, but I would say not my first choice when thinking of other options in the Bay Area.

Their teppan curry is excellent. Food comes out sizzling hot and when the curry is poured on your plate, it combines with the egg and rice in a way that really helps the entire dish become flavorful.

Sashimi tasted buttery and prepared correctly. Plus the portions for the amount you pay is quite fantastic in my option, especially for being right in SF.

Also to the staff and owner: the lady who works during your lunch service is lovely. I rarely feel like commenting on service is necessary in a yelp review, but she's always so sweet and attentive. It always encourages me to come during the lunch service specifically.
author: Nikki L.

description: This place isnt super gourmet, but it's the definition of comfort food for an Asian palette. They specialize in curries, ramen, teriyaki etc. I have to especially recommend the curry ramen, with your choice if protein. Gosh. Its the yummiest thing you can eat: its just full of an absurd amount of goodies. In fact I usually get the vegan version (every green) and its full of so many toppings, and a rich curry broth, that I don't even need the soft boiled egg that I usually get. If you can't handle spice, you can relax, Japanese style curry is super mild, its just very flavorful. For people like me who love spice, they have a delicious hot sauce on the side that I haven't seen anywhere else.
author: Crystal Y.

description:
***3.5 stars***

my bff wanted to come here for her birthday meal, so we came here for lunch on a sat afternoon.  i was a bit concerned about parking, since this was outer mission than bernal heights, but fortunately, was able to secure a free, untimed space about 2 1/2 blocks away.

i had made a reservation at 13.00 since i wasn't sure how crowded it would be, but upon arrival, realized that i could have gotten away without calling in advance...good to know for the future!

as soon as we were given menus, we were informed that they do not serve sushi at lunchtime.  i was quite disappointed to hear this since i had my heart set on ordering some rolls for lunch!  oh well...onto choice #2!

we ordered edamame ($5) to start, but we barely touched this appetizer since it wasn't long before our entrees were ready.

my friend ordered the r3 - chashu ramen with tonkotsu flavor ($11.50).  her bowl was colorful with three generous sized pieces of chashu pork, half of a soft-boiled egg, corn, onions, bean sprouts, spinach, bamboo shoot, and mushrooms.  i know she enjoyed it b/c she finished every last bite!

i ordered the salmon teriyaki plate ($14), which consisted of two pieces of salmon, a flower-shaped scoop of white rice, and mixed green salad.  it was very pretty and colorful, and tasted pretty good, but i felt the portion of salmon was a bit on the small size.  i was actually left wanting more, and not quite full at the end of this meal.

service was prompt and accurate, and we were always greeted with a smile.  restrooms were in the rear and generally pretty clean.  i saw some additional seating in the back, although very few customers were here.

overall, a reasonably good place to have some japanese food.  ramen is probably the way to go, and the biggest bang for your buck at this establishment.
author: Ellen L.

description:
I'm not that much of a fan of katsu but if I ever did want some I'd come here! Cozy place and their donkatsu is actually good (again, coming from someone who isn't the best katsu critic).

Today I got their soft shell crab ramen just for fun because I wanted to try something new. Usually i stick with the basics and get shoyu with chasu but this intrigued me. And it was fun and satisfying and pretty delicious! They used REAL CRAB which was impressive. The broth was a little saltier than I like it, but the noodles were the perfect chewy. I wouldn't get it again just cause crab ramen is not my thing but if you want something different than this is definitely a fun option.

Another ramen place to add to my list of ramen places outside of the city city!
author: Nicole L.
John A.

description: My cousin brought me out here. We're both Punjabi- indian and this was perfect. The server was great and made recommendations for me any cousin who's been here before.
author: Harmen B.

description:
Not a bad place! Yelped around before settling on this spot to take my family for dinner, and we all enjoyed our meals. There are some pros and cons I want to post though...

Cons: Little space, long wait for everything, and Katsu could use a smidge more seasoning... 

Pros: Friendly service, very trendy atmosphere, curry has nice flavor, and orders were all perfect. 

Obviously in San Francisco at dinner time with a party of 6, it can be hard to accomdate such a big group in a tiny flat so I applaud the two waitresses who did the best they could. But it still took a while for us to order, get drinks, and get our meals... Although when they arrived it was all worth the wait. My only other personal complaint is the curry ramen had no heat, but they have a delicious chili paste that quickly resolved that issue.

So, end result is a good restaurant with a bit of a wait, but good food.
author: Chloe G.

description:
Came here for a quick dinner on Thursday night. It was pretty packed the entire time we were there. 

I ordered the Pork Katsu with mild curry and it was delicious. The pork was perfectly fried. Not greasy or soggy. The curry was good. It tastes like the Japanese curry cubes you can buy from the grocery store. 

The portions are pretty big and my Katsu came with a side salad and corn. I really liked the piece of deep fried lotus root.

The prices are fair and the location is convenient. I will def return and try the other dishes on the menu.

EDIT: I came back and tried the Tonkotsu ramen and it was meeh. The soup base was flavorful, but not in a good way. It wasn't rich and lacked the right flavors. It just tasted like salty soup. The noodles were good. The right kind of chewy. The egg has lots of flavor. I ordered my ramen with the pork katsu instead of the traditional chashu. The pork was still yummy, but a little drier than the last katsu that I had with them.  

Overall, I'll still come back for the curry, but not the ramen. Maybe next time I'll try the sushi.
author: Junella T.

description:
Small place, friendly staff, and good portions. I like that they have a kids menu. 

My son liked his chicken teriyaki.

The chicken karrage was ok.

I got the soft shell crab curry. The soft shell crab was big and crispy, but I would ask for my sauce on the side next time because I don't like my rice drenched in sauce. 

Hubby got the pork katsu teppan curry. Comes on a sizzling platter and you pour the sauce on top while it sizzles with the egg on the bottom. Delicious.

Tried the tan tan ramen-it was ok. Broth was decent and noodles weren't bad, but wouldn't come back from ramen again.
author: Karen H.

description:
Adorable Japanese curry house with tasty teppan katsu curry and friendly service! 

Service // 
I came here with my bf on a Thursday night and thankfully it wasn't too busy as we easily got a seat. The waitress brought us menus and waters upon sitting down. Service was friendly and attentive and our waitress would check up on us now and then to make sure we were doing ok. 

Feel // 
Atmosphere was cozy and intimate feeling. There were a few families and couples eating in the restaurant in casual wear. I was in jeans and a sweater. 

Food // 
-As an appetizer, we decided to get the takoyaki. I thought it was pretty good, came with a decent piece of octopus in the center of a perfectly cooked doughy and well seasoned with sauce ball of delight. 

-Because of the yelp reviews, my bf and i decided to cave in and try the teppan pork katsu curry at spicy level. It was delcious! I didn't think that the curry was overly spicy, so I would probably be a bit more bold and try the extra spicy. My bf on the other hand was sweating and sniffling through the night, but he also just doesn't handle spice all that well (but he loves it). The pork katsu had a nice crisp to it and I love that the teppan curry had a blanket of egg surrounding the rice. The waitress made a wonderful show of pouring the curry onto the sizzling plate for us. Beautiful. 

Overall // 
I really enjoyed this place. There aren't a lot of japanese curry houses in SF so having one so close to us is pretty nice.
author: Emily T.

description:
Nourishing and satisfying, everytime.

Fumi not only delivers fabulously savory ramen, but is kind enough to accommodate my vegetarian needs to their mushroom lovers ramen.

Solid place for your ramen needs, and an inviting aesthetic, as well.
author: Wendell A.

description:
Fumi has great ramen! Who knew such a place existed in Bernal Heights. I live in San Mateo than a lot of places there.

I ordered the Spicy Miso ramen. And WOW. It didn't taste super heavy
author: Brian L.

description: Probably one of the best ramens in Bernal Heights/Mission area! The broth and meat perfectly blend together and the ambience of this place is excellent Next time you come don't forget cash cause they'll give you 5% discount on your first visit!
author: Moorissa T.

description:
This was my second time here, and the experience has been consistently good!  Great curry, decent service, and a cozy atmosphere.

My husband and I shared two dishes for lunch - both were generously sized:

1) Black curry with tempura shrimp - excellent!  The squid ink curry was delicious, the tempura was great, and I appreciated the fact they served it with a side salad!

2) Teppan curry with pork Katsu - good.  This was a novel dish for us - served on a sizzling grill, the dish contained an egg base, topped with rice and pork katsu.  The curry sauce was then poured over the dish by our waitress, sizzling in front of us!  The flavor of the dish was good, but we didn't like it as much as the black curry.

The service was decent - polite but a bit slow.

The setting is modern, clean, and pleasant.

Overall, a great spot for Japanese curry!  So glad to have it in our neighborhood.
author: Barnali D.

description:
Nice curry spot!

This place specializes in curry, and it does not disappoint!

We saw the yelp photos of the legendary black curry, so had to give it a try. It's actually pretty good, and even though it made my teeth black for a while, the taste is actually like actual japanese curry. It's also pretty funny to see the soft shell crab "swimming" in the "black sea". Ha ha ha

We also got the normal pork katsu curry rice, which was served on a hot plate teppan that sizzles when you pour the gravy over ALL the rice and ALL the meat. There is even a lotus root on the top of the plate. Niceeeeee

The portions are ok. Slightly more than you need to be full. The price is a big high, since it's $14 for a plate of soft shell crab curry rice, for lunch. But hey, you have to try it at least once right? So the price is worth it.

The service is ok. The food took a while to come out, which was odd because we'd thought they'd have the curry ready on "standby" in the back. Perhaps not. The tables are clean, as are the restrooms etc. The inside is actually pretty big, with a huge "back area" that has more tables than you see in the front.

They have a huge variety of food on the menu, like ramen. Have to try it some other time.

Good for some japanese curry cravings!
author: Henry L.

description:
This place is legit for curry. I prefer it to muracci's and like it as much as Volcano Curry (context: I only get medium or mild spiciness, so this may be different at the top end). I go for Katsu curry, and the katsu is crispy and has a nice light batter and the curry is nice and flavorful.

Don't get ramen here though. It was pretty underwhelming.
author: Ray N.

description:
The restaurant itself is small. The food however is yummmy! The curry can be mild, spicy or very spicy. 

There are different options available for ramen. The broth is delicious.

There are only 2 servers so there could be a wait.
author: Alyssa B.

description: I had a craving for ramen and decided to try this spot bc it was right by my friend's home.  It's a small venue and we quickly got seated when we stepped in.  I ordered the chicken karaage and the spicy miso pork belly ramen.  The broth was indeed spicy and the pork belly was cooked well.  Service was very quick and I really want to try the curries they have next time! I would definitely eat here again.  =)
author: Honey S.

description: It's a solid curry house. Doesn't seem to be an authentic Japanese run but it's pretty hard to mess up Japanese curry.
author: David K.

description:
I'm all about that sizzle sizzle life.

You need to get the teppan curry rice!  For a few dollars more than the regular curry plate, you get egg and that wonderful sizzling hot plate that adds a glorious layer of crispy rice to your already delicious curry experience.  I got the katsu curry and it was probably the best curry I've had in San Francisco (Muracci ain't got nothin on Fumi!).  I'd go more often, but it's a little out of the way for me.

Tips and Tricks
-You can tell your server to pour the curry slowly and get a pretty bomb Instagram video, just saying
author: Jessica L.

description:
Flavorful and fulfilling Japanese curry in the Mission. 

[FOOD]
- Takoyaki [1/5]: I had high expectations for the takoyaki but they just came out looking very sad and deflated. Flavoring is okay but it lacked substance inside (not enough octopus, tempura scraps, etc) and out (not enough picked ginger, green onion and sauce). It was disappointing. 

- Fried Pork Japanese Curry [3/5]: Pork was tender and flavorful, with a good amount of rice and curry. It also came with a small side of salad. 

[PRICE]:
- Appetizers ranged around ~$6, and curry around $11-14. Decent price for Japanese food since they tend to a little more expensive.

[SERVICE/SETTING]:
Friendly waiter and food was served within 10 minutes. We arrived at 6pm and was able to be seated immediately, but a crowded started forming around 7pm. Free street parking nearby.
author: Wendy F.

description:
Just my personal preference, but this was by far the worst tasting "ramen" I've ever had. Service from staff was friendly and helpful, which is the saving grace of such an awful meal. Ordered tonkatsu tender chicken ramen--broth tasted nothing like the rich pork base that gives tonkatsu its distinct flavor. Instead, broth was overly salty and just tasted like salty chicken
broth with some chicken fat thrown in to thicken it up; not something I ever want to consume again. "Tender chicken" was just boiled chicken, completely tasteless, devoid of salt, and on the other extreme end of the salty broth. I ordered because it was within walking distance but ended up just feeling angry that I spent money on such an awful meal.
author: Evelyn S.

description:
A friend and I ate here on Sunday Feb 11th for lunch, and ordered the "vegan curry" combo. This is the only meal that we ate together. 

The next morning, we both had the following symptoms - 

1) diarrhea
2) abdominal cramping
3) headache
4) low grade fever 

I then checked their health report, which shows multiple high risk violations. Beware.
author: Justin Y.

description:
I LOVE Fumi! I usually order delivery but I've dined at their restaurant once. When I order takeout I usually have a predictable, awesome experience and usually my food arrives earlier... but something happened yesterday that I found strange. 

I pre-ordered my usual before the store opened (ordered at 4:53, Fumi opened at 5). Placed my ordered via yelp that would be fulfilled by grubhub, said I would get it by 5:35 pm. Yay! I waited.

5:45 rolls around and no phone call no nothing, so I call the restaurant and they my order was taken so I hang up and wait.

6:18 rolls around and I'm hangry. I call the restaurant, they say it's been taken and I should call the driver so they gave me his information and I call him. He doesn't pick up. 

6:25, 50 minutes LATER than the estimated time of arrival (1 hour and 25 minutes after the restaurant opened) I received my food. The driver apologized, I asked what happened and he blamed the restaurant. I walk away starting to assume it was his fault and he used it as an excuse, but I take the food and go inside.

I open my meal to see how fresh it was. The salad was soggy. I don't know what that cool vegetable thing they put on it, but it was soggy too. The chicken katsu was like warm but luckily the curry was still very warm. 

I have my suspicions of what happened. I don't know if it was the restaurant or the delivery guy's fault. I've never had a problem with Fumi delivery so if it WAS his fault, they should NOT use him anymore and is more than willing to throw a restaurant he works with under the bus. If it was the restaurant's fault, I don't know what to say other than I'm really disappointed. 

4 stars instead of 5 for this strange ordeal, but when the food DOES come out fresh and hot it's soooo good!
author: Krystle P.

description:
Go to Fumi for their teppan curry rice, it's the bomb! The teppan curry rice arrived on a cast iron pan sizzling and kept the curry rice hot.  Definitely a winter comfort food but nothing wrong with eating it in the summer too.  The curry sauce was thick and had a nice depth to it unlike some other places with runny curry sauce that taste generic and store bought.  The burnt crust around the edge was a bonus!

Ramen was lack luster and the pork belly was so dry can barely bite into it.
author: Shirley H.

description:
I tried the chicken katsu ramen my first time here and the pork katsu curry my second time around.

Ramen is good, felt like a good meal after a hangover.

Pork katsu curry rice is amazing. It comes with a nice small salad and corn. There was definitely more than enough curry for the pork and rice.

Service is great!! The waitress greeted me, checked in on me, and was smiling the whole time. She's great! And this was both occasions with the first and second occasions being about a year apart.

Overall:
Ramen: 4/5
Curry: 5/5
Service: 5/5

Definitely no reason to not come back here. I know I'll come back when I'm too lazy to make my own curry or am sick of my own curry.
author: Alvin D.

description: The only place I know that has a whole soft shell crab as ramen and curry rice topping. Black curry is pretty tasty.
author: Ari C.

description:
I loveee that they give every table a whole pot of fukujinzuke pickles!! My FAVORITEEE thing to eat with curry.

I read that their teppan curry was the thing to get, but I love noods so I had to go with the chicken katsu udon curry. Curry was very subtle in flavor but the katsu was fried really nicely. That spicy stuff they have on the table is really good too, a savory spice which I enjoyed.

I'd definitely come back again, even got my husband a pork katsu to-go and he demolished it. 

Waitress was really nice, and kept refilling waters, she even gave me a little sauce container for me to fill up on the pickles. HEHE
author: Christine M.

description:
My overall experience was very nice. I came here on a Sunday afternoon and was seated right away. I didn't expect anything out of this place because this was not the original lunch place I wanted to go to but it definitely exceeded my expectations. The atmosphere was simple and soft jazz was playing. The waitress was very nice and got our order right away and brought out our drinks fast.

I ordered the Pork Katsu Teppan Curry. The waitress brought it out with a boat of curry and even poured it on for me. I am always amazed by things that sizzle. The pork katsu was very moist on the inside and perfectly crispy on the outside. The rice was also made very well to where it wasn't too soft and mushy. 

My boyfriend ordered the Chashu Tonkotsu Ramen. I tried it out and tonkotsu soup base was so flavorful. It had a hint of herbal taste but very very slight. The soft boil egg was perfect where it was still runny on the inside. Not many places make there soft boiled eggs correctly but this one was good. The noodles were not too soft and still chewy. The chashu was was good nothing too amazing but everything went together nicely.
author: Ada N.

description:
Everything here is ridiculously on point, but the Japanese Curry is the star of the show. As soon as you sit down in the restaurant, you will be seduced by curry aroma. My favorite dish is the Hamburger teppan curry, which arrives in a cast iron dish, anointed in curry, with a 1950s style gravy boat of more curry to the side. You will eat all of that curry, and wish for more.

As you start to develop a dangerous curry addiction, you can branch into the excellent sushi and noodle options also available here.

They also serve a nice array of beer and sake.

Service is consistent, friendly, and courteous. The music is always the same cycle of classic jazz.
author: Tasha D.

description:
I came because one of my friends posted a video of the teppan curry so I knew I had to come here as soon as I got a chance. I ordered the katsu teppan curry, which is a bit expensive, but it was delicious. I love the rice and how crisp it gets on the pan. I just wish I got more curry to eat with the meal. Still, I really liked the food here and I have to say, while I have never seen them do this in Japan, it's my new favorite way of eating Japanese curry!
My bf tried the ramen and I took a sip of the broth and it was pretty decent. No complaints. This was great for lunch and we came here at around 7PM on a Friday and didn't have to wait!
author: Jenn T.

description:
If you come here and don't get the Teppan Curry, you are making a huge mistake. I've tried the other dishes, including the ramen and sushi, but the Teppan Curry is one of a kind. Literally. 

Teppan Curry is served on a sizzling hot plate. In the center is a mound of rice topped with your choice of meat (I always, always either go with Chicken Katsu or Hamburger steak), surrounded by sizzling egg, and once it arrives to your table, the server pours a gravy dish filled with Japanese curry on top of the egg making for an instagrammable delicious meal. 

Let me break down each component for you. It is that good.

The chicken katsu is perfectly fried and seasoned. Not too salty, not soggy at all, and the perfect thickness. The hamburger steak (Japanese style) has all the right flavors, is tender af, and will make you crave more. 

Some Japanese curry places are clearly from a base out of a box, which is not always bad. But Fumi curry has almost a tomato base, making the sweetness balance with the salty of the topping. 

Yes the ramen may be alright, but the Teppan curry is the thing to get. You can't get it anywhere else.
author: Anthony G.

description: Ordered hot plate curry noodles--really good!
author: Maggie S.

description:
Stopped by Fumi on my trip to San Francisco. I was recommended this place by a friend who said that there curry is delicious. The ramen was not. I order the California ramen - which came with little to adequate portion of avocado and crab meat.

Nothing amazing compared to other ramens I had. The broth was really salty, which made my experience poor. Maybe next time I'll give this place another shot by ordering a curry dish.
author: William T.

description:
I'm conflicted writing this because I don't want this place to blow up and then I'll have to wait 1-2 hours

LOVED: aaamaazing curry, tasty flavors, best Japanese curry I've had in my life, vibe, sake selection, even got free edamame bc we spent $15+ on drinks, service was great, absolutely the best! Don't come here lol

author: Jul C.

description: Very good! Seated right away. Chicken Katy's curry was good! Seaweed salad good. Tempura good. Hard to find parking but eh, that's the mission. Highly recommend
author: Jose V.

description: Had lunch here last week with a colleague. The first impression is that the decor is sparse and in no way inviting. Honestly if the food was a standout I'd be perfectly ok with that - gotta love a good "joint". Unfortunately the meal was equally disappointing. I was feeling the mood for Japanese but not ramen.  Ended up ordering the Teriyaki Chicken. Perhaps that was my mistake as other reviews for Fumi are pretty positive. That said, Teriyaki Chicken is a staple - it's gotta be done right. The chicken was dry and tough and had no flavor. I ended up pushing the meat to the side and just ate the rice - pretty hard to ruin but it definitely could have benefitted from more teriyaki sauce which was very sparse. I don't have reason to be in the neighborhood often but if I am, likely i'll opt for a different restaurant.
author: Karen O.

description: The best vegetarian Ramen I have ever tasted! Curry flavor is strong with lots of great toppings! DONT add fried garlic since the taste is strong and competes with the broth. Other than that simply delicious with reasonable prices!
author: Shasha K.

description:
To find a curry as hot as chef curry is difficult. 

Curry involves harmony between all the different spices with not just one tone of flavor, but a burst of it all. Curry is such a comforting food that it should take you through your childhood memories as you take your first bite. Curry is something that you hope to never finish as you just want to keep eating more and more. 

It's very hard to find authentic good curry in the Bay. So far my FAVORITE is Muracci in Chinatown with the chain Curry House in Los Angeles as my second go to. 

Fumi's namesake includes curry and ramen. With Coco's ramen right nearby, I'm safe to say that Fumi probably does curry better. 

I ordered the Fish Katsu Teppan Curry. 

What is teppan?
"The iron plate"

You want curry, might as well go all out with the Teppan. It comes sizzling hot and the egg is cooked around the rice. The sizzling creates a nice crispy bottom layer on the rice to resemble those of clay pots. My senses arouse as the sizzle and smoke continue in front of me. 

A mild curry was definitely mild as I regretted not ordering a level up. Their curry was great and so was everything else! Fish katsu was fried perfectly. I managed to finish the whole thing without a single piece of rice left. Towards the end, I was running out of curry but I wasn't sure if it was due to my proportional errors. 

This place is definitely a treat located in Bernal Heights. They also have ramen and sushi, but I'd stay away if possible. 

Fifi approves and suggests to also try their black curry. "Once you go black, you can't go back."
author: Fiona L.

description: Just go and try one of the hotplates. I would add pickled radishes next time if it's offered on the menu.
author: Cheech B.

description: First time eating here and so far I am satisfied! Their curry is good... I did try Pork Katsu Teppan Curry and Spicy Miso Ramen. Over all Iam happy with the taste and quality. Will definitely recommend curry and ramen .... oooops!I have also trued their dragon roll and its impressive.
author: Mikoyan C.

description:
Been here a few times and been pleasantly surprised by the quality of the food here each time!

Definitely get curry and consider skipping out on ramen here (Coco's Ramen next door is better imo). Fumi's curry is their forté, and it's better than Curry House in Cupertino! The curry sauces (both squid ink and regular) are extremely flavorful, spicy (not in the hot sense, but full of aromatic spices), and not too heavy or salty at all! Wonderfully made. Even the rice is worth mentioning - they cook it to a perfect texture that complements the curry so well.

We ordered the fish teppan curry last time, and boy it was sooo delicious. $14 was well worth it! The hot griddle also has an egg on it, which just sizzles with the curry sauce, making it so yummy. You won't regret ordering it :) 

Also tried the hamachi kama here before, for $10 it was very worth too. Good portion, and very well-handled with the charring and doneness. :D
author: Maggie G.

description: The little restaurant in the Mission splits its menu between ramen and curry. If you are curious about black curry, this is the place to try it. A few years ago, there was a fad for black food in Japan: black burgers (including black buns), black spaghetti, and black curry, to name just three. All this blackness is courtesy of squid ink, which is plentiful in Japan, and lends a pleasing, mild flavor to savory dishes. I've tried the black curry at Fumi's and it is quite good, although it does impart a startling black hue to one's tongue. My favorite though, is the teppan shrimp curry. The curry rice option comes with deep fried prawns and lotus slice atop a hill of rice with a moat of raw egg, which quickly cooks into an omelet on the iron plate. The curry comes on the side, allowing you to pour as much as you wish. The egg noodle teppan option comes with boiled shrimp and a fried egg on the side. Again, the curry comes on the side. Both dishes are satisfying, particularly on a chilly San Francisco summer day.
author: Priscilla O.

description: I came here and we ordered the chicken katsu curry and chashu ramen. Both tasted kind of bland. The curry tasted like sour potatoes for the most part, wasn't too flavorful, but the chicken katsu was pretty crispy. The salad on the side lacked dressing. The ramen was ok. A little bland as well, the chashu had no flavor to it. But the broth was more flavorful and was a concentrated broth. The restaurant itself is lovely, very homey and clean. I was bummed they didn't serve sushi items for lunch. Overall, it's an okay place. Would not recommend the curry however, you're better off ordering the ramen. Wish I got to try the sushi. And finally, this place doesn't really give me much incentive to come back.
author: amy k.

description: You guys.. this curry takes me right back to Tokyo! Delicious and ultra fast delivery. So good! Arigato!
author: Jess L.

description:
The sad thing is, I like the curry here. I ordered their curry several times for pick-up. But recent visits were VERY unpleasant by the way waitress treated me when I was picking up my order.

I ordered online and after 20 min or so I walked into the restaurant. The two waitresses seemed to be pretty busy, so I was waiting at the counter. They walked right in front of me bringing foods to the tables, after several times I still got no words. 

After 5 min or so, another customer walked in. And then, one of the waitresses greeted her right away, and asked her if she's there to pick up. The waitress knew that I have been there for a while, but she somehow decided to still ignore me and greet the customer who came after me.

At this point I was really frustrated (especially because this happened last time I was here) I asked this waitress why she was ignoring me. Then she just looked at me and bluntly said, "OK SO ARE YOU PICKING UP OR WHAT."

My last two visits to here were very similar to this. Both times this same waitress treated me the same way. I felt like I was very un-welcomed. I don't know what made her treat me differently than this other customer, what made her think it is ok to ignore me and not to ignore this other customer. I wonder if this restaurant thinks it's ok for their waitresses to treat their customers differently based on whatever it is.

Again, I liked their curry. But unfortunately, after what had happened to me and it seems it's a recurring occurrence, I don't feel like going back there if i know I will be treated like a second class customer for them.

I thought of giving one star because my experience was so unpleasant. But added one more star because of their curry.
author: Haiden I.

description:
Sister dearest was craving curry so curry place we went. Ordered a couple sushi rolls and appetizers before our entree. Sushi rolls were just okay. Hamachi carpaccio was slightly fishy and not as thin as expected. The main entree that I decided to order was the curry ramen with chicken katsu. Ramen was perfectly cooked, chewy, al dente noodles. Curry was slightly bland, but complimented the chicken katsu alright. Other dishes that my party ordered were the black curry teppan with tonkatsu and regular curry teppan with a side of chicken katsu. The presentation looked great, but taste was either too bland or did not have any curry taste at all (this was the black curry). 

Note- if you order the black curry, you might not taste any curry at all... the sauce is soooo interesting,  I still don't know what it is made from... mystery taste right there.  

Overall, the ambiance was alright (didnt turn on AC until an hr or two into dinner service.. place is small but cozy.. service was great, but the food was just okay but forgettable. 

Ps- matcha milk tea did not taste like matcha at all... it was more like sweet soy milk with a hint of tea. skip if needed. It wasn't even green!!
author: Samantha W.

description:
YES YES YES. A veritably CHILL and reasonably priced general asian food restaurant that mainly serves curry and noodles. This errs more on the side of comfort asian food, which SF honestly needs more of. There is a lot of transcendence across geo-political food boundaries here (Korean and Japanese and Chinese all in one menu), but I ain't even mad.

Chicken Katsu and beef curries give off Go!Go!Curry! vibes. There are many, many vegetarian options as well. It's a nice place to come for a filling dinner, boozy asian drinks, and classic izakaya fried fare (tempura, takoyaki, agedashi tofu, karaage, etc.) 

This is the kind of restaurant you come back to time and time again for consistent food and service.
author: Susan L.

description: Black curry is their special!! So good! My wife and I usually share the sushi and order our own entree! Cozy and clean restaurant!
author: Marleet P.

description:
This place has the best Japanese curry! We have gone here on date night, and recently for a party, and service was outstanding ,despite our large group with high demand, and noise...There is a back area for parties which feels more special for events!

Food came out promptly and was, per usual, super yummy! They have amazing vegan options as well.

Thanks Fumi, you are ForMe!
author: Nika C.

description:
If KFC chicken deserves a 1.5 stars, this place gets a 5. All my reviews will revolve around KFC. 

I ordered a fish katsu curry over rice. The food was $11.95. The curry was what you can expect from a good Japanese meal. The sauce was smooth and had good flavor. Portion size is pretty filling too. Considering that a typical meal at KFC is around $10, this cannot compete. 

The service is good too. Our waitress probably refilled our water jugs five times or more. The place seems pretty clean too. Thanks!

I came on a Sunday evening and the place is not too packed. There are multiple tables in the private room for larger parties. I do like to mention that we had 11 people and the 18% tip was already posted on our bill. A SF standard.

I would not say that this is the best Japanese curry I've ever eaten, but it's still pretty good. If you do end up liking this place, I also recommend Usagi in San Mateo and Volcano in SF
author: Geoffrey W.

description: I really love their food here (traditional Japanese curry). I get their teppan steak every time. It's a low-key place and their service is mind.
author: Terrie C.

description: Great ramen, noodles taste fresh and the spicy broth was delicious. The location is closer to Mitchell's ice cream so get dessert there.
author: Mathieu G.

description:
We ate curry at Fumi ramen one Friday night, and the Warriors won a game during the finals ^^V (Curry pun intended... hahahaha)

From our visit, the star was definitely the curry (no pun intended this time). For a city with a prominent food scene, SF is surprisingly scant in legit, worthy Japanese curry. Japantown is mediocre and tastes like box curry; Volcano is underwhelming and seems like a joint that would belong in a mall food court; Murraci's is just about the only decent place, but it is a very small and more of a hole-in-the-wall pit stop than a comfy sit-down dinner like Fumi.

We got the chicken katsu teppan curry, and it was outstanding--a cloud of smoke rose as the server poured the curry over the sizzling teppan plate. (Exciting! I suggest capturing a video to oneup your food porn) The housemade curry had excellent umami flavor, a tantalizing spice blend, and wasn't too salty. An equally impressive aspect was the heavenly interplay of textures. Not only was the rice perfectly charred like the bottom of clay pot rice or dolsot bibimbap; the egg was crisped as well. Together with the katsu featuring a crunchy panko exterior and juicy meaty interior, this was a very satisfying dish. The pictures of the curry rice plates do look a bit small, as other reviewers have pointed out, so I would recommend sticking to the more avant-garde teppan curry. 

The ramen turned out to be just alright; it will do to satisfy ramen cravings but I do prefer Coco's in Bernal for the wow factor. The broth was attenuated in tonkotsu flavor, mildly creamy, and less salty (to our liking). The portion size was just sufficient, conveniently leaving space for dessert at Mitchell's afterwards P: Although it came with the basics of half an egg, 3 chashu slices, menma, kikurage, corn, and spinach, it could definitely use a larger quantity of each topping. My favorite part of my ramen was the soft-boiled egg, which was on point with its mastery of the liquid gold yolk. They also have more unique ramen options, such as the California ramen with avocado and soft shell crab ramen (The boo was interested in this, but I thought the soft shell crab looked creepy like it was about to walk out of the ramen bowl any moment.)

Dinner totaled to $24 pre-tip, very affordable for quality noms in SF. They also have happy hour 5-7pm with BOGO dranks but unfortunately we didn't notice until we left and saw the poster outside (and they have Asahi black!!). The ambiance is nice and relaxing, with traditional Japanese decor that is homey but not flashy and abstract like many Japanese places these days. (Plus, nothing can beat an ambiance of Totoro music in the background) Service is efficient and attentive, and the owner is very friendly. Hurray for small businesses--even though Fumi is newer to the neighborhood, it feels very personable and non-gentrification-y while adding delicious traditional Japanese curry to the SF food scene.
author: Edna C.

description:
Delicious orders of curry rice with katsu pork and tempura shrimp. I ordered mine at medium spicy and could have gone for the spiciest setting. 

We liked the food so much we went home and tried our hand at it the next night. It was good, but Fumi's was much better.
author: Steve L.

author: Cesar A.

description: Had their Californian Ramen, which included a few crab legs. Overall, very delicious.
author: Darren W.

description:
Came here for dinner on a weekday around 6. Was seated immediately at the bar. What I liked about this place is that it allows you to customize many aspect of your meals. Choose your broth, choose your protein and finally choose your toppings. Same goes for the curry dishes-- choose your sauce and protein. They also have sushi here, although I personally wouldn't recommend it since I sat at the bar and didn't think the fish seemed that fresh here. 

 I ordered the regular chashu ramen, which came with half an egg. The broth overall seemed like it was watered down where they added in salt to compensate for it. The pork itself was kind of dry. Overall, I would say that the ramen is only 'okay' and would probably recommend getting a curry dish instead because that's what the seems like this place is known for. 

TLDR; Ramen was only okay, would come back to try their curry dishes. Good and fast service.
author: Jenny N.

description:
Wow the Teppan Japanese Curry with Shrimp was amazingg. I'm not one to get over-impressed by food presentation. When it came out and the waitress came over and started pouring the curry over the sizzling omelette, I was like 'kay this is cool. Now how is it going to taste?' Reallly good.
