I'm a fan of stone cooked dishes like stone hot bibimbap. The heat from the plate below gave the bottom of the rice a crunchy burnt texture and mixed with the egg, curry, and shrimp. Just really great. It may not be authentic Japanese curry, but it's pretty delicious and definitely worth trying.

Ambience-wise, the restaurant is small but not cramped nor overcrowded with people. It's a good place with to have dinner conversations since noise-level isn't bad at all.
author: Kim L.

description: I order this every time I'm missing Cocos Curry. It's as close as we can find to the cherry we fell in love with in Tokyo.
author: Chase L.

description: Ok. I've upgraded Fumi to 5 stars. This place is consistently delicious, has a really nice vibe, and always has good service. I was sold on that extra star when I opted for a different order--I tried the curry udon (substitute ramen with udon noodles), medium spicy. It was exactly what I was looking for! Fumi folks sure know their curry. Get yourself here in a hurry! (rhyme!)
author: Kate V.

description: I wanted ramen, I wanted curry. They put all my hopes and dreams in a bowl and made them come true. Thank you Fumi!
author: Jess F.

description:
We wanted a chill dinner that we didn't have to cook or clean up after, because we are permanently tired. Because we have a two year old. And the irony is that almost every time we try to go out for dinner it's more stressful, not relaxing. 

But Fumi was great! There was room so we didn't have to either wait with an impatient toddler or be shoved into some tiny bistro table that keeps getting bumped by bustling waiters. 

They had a baby seat right away. They let us order her kids meal (see photo) right away while we were still deciding on our food. They brought plastic utensils and a cup with lid and straw right away. The music was nice and chill and it wasn't loud or echoey in the space. 

Our food was great. Had the Dragon roll and salmon teriyaki. Baby had kid's curry rice, which came with salad and corn and half a smoked egg.
author: Oscia W.

description: Food is delicious but service is really slow. Waited 30 minutes for a table, and 50 minutes for our main entrees. The table next to us were seated after us, ordered before us, finished their food and left the restaurant before we got our food. The curry ramen with chicken katsu are bomb. I'd definitely come back but probably during off hours.
author: Nicole B.

description: Tasty combinations of ramen and katsu dishes with really yummy thick slices of sashimi. Took my cousin here who loved it. He had the curry ramen with pork katsu on the side and I had the mushroom special ramen with chashu. We split edamame and salmon sashimi. Great food without the fuss, nice gem in Bernal.
author: T L.

description: The worst ramen I've ever had. It was so salty and blah. The chicken in the soup had an odd texture and taste and the noodles were one giant clump. I was so disappointed.
author: Shara H.

description:
First time here, I have to say their servers is great and fast.

I ordered a custom curry and my friend ordered a California ramen.

Both soup are on the salty side of it, not sure why it's very salty.

my next visit I will try something else
author: Mack A.

description:
5 stars for food which tastes authentic and prepared by experienced cooks. 4 stars for the atmosphere and ambience, nice Japanese style interior and it's pretty quiet. 3 stars for service that could be better. I didn't like the attitude of staff. Price is 4 out of 5 only because of the service.
Overall, the food is perfect, service has to be improved. Will give it one more chance later and update this review.
author: Mark K.

description: I had a Pork Katsu Teppan Curry, and found a hair in it. I was wearing a baseball cap so it was certainly not my hair. The waitress took the plate away and brought me a new one. But by that time, it was unappetizing. And they charged me.
author: Jane M.

description:
Fumi is a decent Japanese place that is very walkable for those in the Mission and Bernal Heights. However, neither its curry nor ramen are that authentic, and the flavor profiles are a bit off.

I've had the chicken katsu curry and tonkotsu ramen. The chicken katsu curry came out looking great, with a generous serving size and some mixed greens dressed with vinaigrette on the side. I asked for the extra spicy option. As I began eating, I noticed red streaks in the curry, and the curry tasting unusually sour. It dawned on me that they simply poured Tabasco sauce in the curry to accommodate "extra spicy". This was a pretty unfortunate discovery. If you're going to offer three different spice levels, it makes sense to make the different curries at those spice levels rather than just adding hot sauce. I could just do that myself.

The tonkotsu ramen looked great as well. However, the broth was overly salty and lacked the rich flavor emblematic of tonkotsu ramen. It was almost as if they felt the need to overcompensate with excessive salt to make up for the light-tasting broth. The chashu pork was a bit chewy and lacked the soft, melt-in-your-mouth texture that I look for in tonkotsu ramen.

Fumi is clean, well-managed, and a nice spot to grab a bite in Mission/Bernal. But based on their unusual flavor profiles of what are meant to be traditional classic dishes, I won't be returning on a regular basis.
author: Tim X.

description:
Loved it! Came in with some friends for ramen on a Friday night, and the place was surprisingly empty so we were seated immediately by the incredibly friendly staff.
The menu has quite a bit of variety, and it was hard to pick anything but I finally settled on the curry ramen with chicken katsu.
Food came out pretty quickly, and it was SO GOOD. The chicken katsu was super crispy, and the ramen itself was amazing. I got the 'spicy' level, and it was enough to give the ramen a kick, but not mask all the delicious curry flavors. The base ramen doesn't come with a ton of toppings so you may wish to add you own, but I was still pretty satisfied. 
My friend got the milder-looking tonkatsu ramen, which was reportedly also delicious. High praise for the pork chasiu, as well! 

Living down the street, I don't think I can resist coming back soon to try the rest of the menu!
author: Gautam G.

description: My favorite go to spot for japanese curry! Teppan Curry is delicious and perfect for a cold windy SF day!
author: Austin R.

description:
Love love love this place. Truly a hidden gem. First off, I've tried a handful of the highly rated *cough* more like overrated *cough* places in SF and those just do not compare to Fumi. First off, the quality of their ramen and curry are great especially for their prices which are a steal for SF. The ramen is perfectly balanced and the noodles are always cooked to perfection. Can you believe I had ramen in Japantown and the noodles were served SOGGY not remotely al dentè?!?!

Anywho, to add on, the waitress who I've seen both times I've been during lunch is so attentive and sweet. I'm so sad I found out about this place the last two weeks I had in SF before moving. Currently dreaming about a bowl of their tonkatsu ramen with some of their perfectly juicy on the inside chicken katsu on top :'(
author: Michelle T.

description:
Japanese curry is my comfort food, especially on cold days. I was craving something warm and spicy during this rainy week so I placed an order of CHICKEN KATSU CURRY (SPICY) through GRUBHUB. I didn't want to venture out in the rain and opted for delivery of food to my office.

The CHICKEN KATSU was breaded and fried perfectly. Chicken can be hit or miss in terms of texture and dryness, but this chicken breast was moist and the breading remained crispy, even in a delivery box. I enjoyed the spiciness of my CURRY--it really warmed me up on a rainy day! Fumi's curry also had an extra citrusy/vinegar flavor to it that went well with the chicken katsu and rice. This dish came with a side of green salad.

Things to note for DELIVERY:

I am unsure if the driver was from Fumi or Grubhub, but he did not follow my instructions for delivery. I work in a building with security so people have to be buzzed into the building. I was very specific in my instructions to call my cell phone upon arrival so I can come downstairs, OR give the security desk my extension so they can ping me. The driver buzzed himself in and just left my food on the counter. He didn't even provide the front desk with my name so they did not know who to call. Good thing I was keeping an eye out on the app so I knew when the food arrived and was able to run downstairs to get it in a timely manner.

For future visits, I think I'll pop into the Bernal Heights location and eat inside the restaurant. However, I am still impressed with the quality and taste of my meal so I may opt for delivery again if I have a strong Japanese curry craving at work.
author: Bonnie Z.

description: Most delicious curry ramen I've ever had. Even though it's the first one I've tried, it's the best. I've been here twice and I've ordered the curry ramen with chicken katsu both times now. This place is great, you should try it!
author: Gerald P.

description:
I came here yesterday, (Saturday) around 7ish for dinner. I have not had Japanese curry in FOREVER and was so psyched to finally find a place in the mission that has it! Right when we walked in we got seated right away next to the window. This place looks small but there's actually a lot more seating in the back. Service was A1 as our server asked us for our drink order right away, asked for order and we got our food super fast!

We ordered a Sapporo and an Asahi. I got the Chicken Katsu Teppan Curry, best decision of my life. Lol pretty much a sizzling plate with rice in the middle, chicken katsu on top and then on the bottom is an egg. The server then brings the curry and poured it around the egg, wowww. It was super bomb. My friend ordered spicy ramen which looked bomb. I plan to definitely come back and try the other curries!!!
author: Veronica A.

description: Decent local Japanese food.  Love their curry ramen and rice plates! Reasonable price.ls.  They get busy after 7pm, but do have extra seating in the back
author: Stephanie A.

description: The food wasn't very special. I have to admit the teppan curry does change the experience, the rice and egg is crispy! However, we waited 30mins+ for food.. It would be nice if the waiter had warned us about the wait. Parking was also difficult in this area.
author: Helen C.

description: Their curry is amazing. I tried it with the rice and chicken katsu and it goes really well. Their salad is also good, with a crispy lotus root on top.
author: Vattanak C.

description:
Love the Pork Katsu Teppan Curry!!! It's brought out on a sizzling plate and you pour curry over the egg around the bed of rice & pork katsu. The warm plate and the spicy curry is a perfect combination especially on a colder day in SF. It's absolutely delicious and not to be missed!

Small restaurant, but they have a larger space in the back so don't be too concerned if the front room is packed. We've never had to wait more than 5 minutes and frequently come on busy Friday/Saturday nights. 

Prices are very reasonable for SF. A large beer (Sapporo / Kiran / Asahi) is $6. The Teppan curry is $13.50 and a solid portion. I always feel very full leaving here!

Highly recommend Fumi Curry next time you're in the area!
author: Caroline T.

description:
I ordered Fumi curry using Seamless the food delivery service so I can't review everything but I'll do what I can!!!  =D
Time of order: 8:15 pm on Friday night
Arrival of food: 8:55 pm
Menu Selection: Such a variety: ramen, sushi, and Japanese curry; usually places that make too many things don't specialize in anything but their curry was excellent, extra points for being able to substitute white rice for brown rice
Food: I got the teppan hamburger curry and my wife got the seafood curry
Taste:  Very authentic tasting Japanese curry; not many places that make this delicacy but it was awesome!  My wife's seafood curry came with a good variety of lots of seafood.  My hamburger curry had below average to average burger (I think I like when there is more bite to my burger and there are chargrilled marks on it, like at Volcano Curry); however, the cooked egg under the beef was so good.  A little on the salty side but a really good complement to the burger and curry!  
Temperature: my wife's was still hot!  Mine was on the cold/warm side but it was delivered so hard to complain
Similar Restaurant: Volcano Curry (Richmond District); Fumi's curry taste was great but it was more expensive but had more quantity and more variety (there is no seafood curry at Volcano), also I always order extra curry at Volcano but not necessary at Fumi, I'm stuffed...
author: Kentaro T.

description:
visited fumi again on sunday.  my family can't get enough of this place.

ordered a couple of katsu curries and a couple of ramen.  the quality has not slipped at all in the years we have been coming.  this speaks to the continuity in the kitchen/family that owns fumi.  well done guys. 

the interesting thing is that we noticed that a third ramen joint has/is slated to open within 50 feet of fumi.  to us, this is the highest compliment to fumi who was here first.  those with no vision copy a good thing and hope for similar success.  

i would recommend you stick with the original as the wanna be's try to siphon off business from the "OG"...
author: C C.

description:
The curries tastes great! We recently ordered from the sushi menu and it was just okay. Probably wouldn't order sushi from here again. 

Anyway, you come here for the curry and the curry is on point! Service is good and will definitely come back.
author: Ruby B.

description:
Absolutely no complaints here! Fumi is a cute little spot that would be good for small groups (would probably not recommend larger than a group of 6?). The menus are adorable!! 

We had:
Curry ramen (medium spicy) with udon noodle + chicken katsu
Curry ramen with ramen noodle + chicken katsu
Agedashi Tofu
Gyoza

Everything was delicious. The katsu was lightly battered so it wasn't too heavy. Didn't get to try their other ramens, but if you are in the mood for curry I would recommend this spot!
author: Christine S.

description:
Came here on a Saturday for lunch and the restaurant had a decent amount of people. 

It's the second time I've been here and of course I got the same thing again: teppan curry chicken katsu. I got medium spicy which was enough to make my lips tingle. 

The sizzling dish was served by the waitress with the curry in a gravy boat, then poured onto the dish- I enjoyed watching it sizzle and form bubbles.

The curry was a little too salty in my opinion. The chicken katsu was nice and crispy, the meat inside was tender and easy to cut with my spoon. I enjoyed it, it was comforting and great for a cool winter day.
author: Amy T.

description: My grandson and I went here based on the good reviews. We really wanted sushi in the neighborhood. The service was excellent. We ordered chicken appetizer which are fried chicken bites which we love. I know some people like fatty chicken but we don't - forcing us to leave half the order. The ramen was very good. They didn't have such a good selection of sushi so I guess the hit is Ramen. My salad dressing was bland and the corn tasted canned. Why not just sell the best? A win-win for everyone.
author: Eva R.

description:
Small modern nice place.
It wasn't busy...only one other party when we came in. 

Edamame...$5. Came out smoky/hot. They probably microwave it cause i heard it from the kitchen a few time. 

Crab egg rolls...$7. They cut the egg rolls in half and put the crab top

Chasu ramen with tonkotsu flavor and regular spiciness...$10.95. I thought the bowl was kinda small for the price. But it varies on ramen restaurant.

Green tea mochi ice cream and stick cracker. Since i came with my mom and brother and only order 1, they were nice enough to cut it 3 ways for us. It was nice to end out meal with this dessert.

To me, i thought the foods were average. But satisfy my ramen fix. Certain food items were kinda expensive. There were only 2 workers working with the customers. They were nice. Service was average
author: Julie N.

description:
I have to admit a certain and probably unfair prejudice when it comes to pork tonkatsu. You have to know that I like it best when it's served in a homey setting like Kitchen Kura where I can pretend like my Okasan made it. It just feels more authentic to me that way like I'm living in a Yasujiro Ozu family drama where over a low-lying dinner table on a tatami, I'm scolded for not finding a proper wife at my advanced age. I was hoping there would be a bit of that feeling at Fumi since I considered it a good sign that it shares the name of my Okasan. Yep, my mom's name was Fumiye. But no, it's quite modern in here with a lot of hipster-style touches and a young staff all dressed in black like a "Sprockets" sketch. Touch my monkey!

It was pretty busy at around 6:30 on a Tuesday evening with the median age of the diners, I'm guessing, around 22. I had to sit up at the three-seat counter, which wasn't necessarily a bad thing, except youngsters would sit next to me in utter despair waiting for their takeout orders. I felt it was essential I order the $10 Pork Katsu, even though it looked identical to all their curry plates in the photo menu. It was presented on a strangely immaculate plate where the katsu slices were fanned out decoratively on a small mound of rice sitting in a pool of watery curry sauce. On the side was a tuft of mixed greens with a dribble of corn kernels (photo: http://bit.ly/1i4o2r7). A food stylist's work of art but...

The pork was a bit dry and flavorless. It looked like it was pounded into submission to make it look symmetrical, and the coating lacked the crunch that would have excited me to no end. I was bummed because my "Tokyo Story" fantasy of a home-cooked meal went poof. I was also disappointed that a $2.50 Diet Coke amounted to one of those Lilliputian aluminum bottles because I usually finish those in ten seconds flat. The surprising highlight of the meal turned out to be my side dish, the $5 Garlic Broccoli because it was fresh and crispy with the chopped garlic providing just the right seasoning (photo: http://bit.ly/1U8eI6C). Gee, I think I could actually make that at home. There are other dishes to consider. Perhaps.

FOOD - 3 stars...pork katsu was marginal but the garlic broccoli almost made up for it
AMBIANCE - 2.5 stars...the set of Sprockets..."Now is ze time on Sprockets vhen ve dance!"
SERVICE - 3.5 stars...nicer than you would expect given the ambiance
TOTAL - 3 stars...Okasan?
author: Ed U.

description:
A good spot for lunch; portions are on the small side. Service is good.

Truthfully, I wasn't impressed with my teriyaki chicken. It was edible but not memorable. I would've rated this place 3 stars if not for my dining companion, a Japanese citizen who'd moved to the US half a year ago, who said the curry was delicious.
author: Barack O.

description:
A decent Chicken Katsu Curry option that doesn't require a trip to Japantown?

HELLS YEAH.

And if the place offers brown rice, clean environs and friendly service?

EVEN BETTER.

And if the Chicken Curry Noodle is underwhelming and has only one sad little stalk of broccoli?

OH WELL.

And if it can appease your curry crazed cravings despite being crazy tired?

THANKS FUMI.
author: Amy C.

description:
My latest obsession is watching Million Dollar Listing San Francisco (MDLSF). I like to fantasize about the day I can buy a house in the city where I was born and raised in for oh you know, a million or two. I figure if Mr. NSS and I both sell our kidneys in the black market, we would have just enough for one quarter of a house at Bernal Heights, the "hottest neighborhood of 2014".

Tell that to Andrew from MDLSF and he'll probably shudder. Can that guy be any more of a douche?

Team Roh! 

Ok, some parts of Bernal Heights isn't exactly the nicest and the some of the streets are as tight as a virgin's whoohaaa but the neighborhood is cute and most people are very friendly. Plus, you can't beat the breathtaking, panoramic from Bernal Hill. One area that Bernal Heights is lacking in is solid Asian restaurants. Ichi doesn't count unless you have a daily food allowance of $80+.

Opening a week and a half ago, Fumi Japanese Curry & Seafood took over the old Eagle Donuts space, next to Pizza Hacker. The space is tiny with seating for 20 and three counter seats. This is not a place for groups larger than 4 but they do take reservations for 6 or more people. 

On the menu are Apps (popcorn shrimp, karaage, gyoza, spring rolls), Salads (Asian crab and ceasar), Soups (kabocha, miso, clam), Curry Rice, Curry Noodles, Teriyaki, Teppan Curry, and Whole Crab. Except for the crab and seafood dishes, everything is less than $12. Portions are filling for the price. They also have kid meals for $6-$7. Vegetarian and brown rice options available. No booze available. 

We started with the Chicken Karaage ($8) which I would pass on: http://bit.ly/1Jfygip. The garlic and ginger flavor was there but I wasn't keen on the batter they used. Instead of using the traditional potato starch coating that produces a deliciously crunchy crust, the [wet] batter was doughy and on the softer side. 

The Pork Katsu Curry Rice ($10) was surprisingly very solid...for Bernal Heights: http://bit.ly/1EAgyR6. The curry sauce is housemade and contains no msg.  I ordered it extra spicy, and it seems like they hiked up the spice levels per earlier Yelp reviews. The curry was nicely thick and fiery with a subtle sweetness. The spices could have been more developed but it was satisfying nonetheless. The katsu was perfectly fried. It was golden, crunchy, and very tender. Just as important was the rice to soak up all that curry, it had just the right amount of stickiness. I added an egg (+$2) which was overcooked. Next time, I would request it sunny side up for some egg yolk porn. Make sure to enjoy your curry with the fukujinzuke pickles that are hidden in a metal container next to the salt and pepper shakers.  

Against my recommendation of sticking with the curry dishes, Mr. NSS ordered the Beef Teriyaki ($11): http://bit.ly/1MwhxIJ. He said it was kinda chewy but alright. I had a piece and it needed more of a sear at a higher temperature and more sauce. 

To cool down the heat, we ordered the Mochi Ice Cream ($3 each) for dessert: http://bit.ly/1KtSFNf. It's just sliced and plated Mikawaya Mochi Ice Cream which I saw them pull from the freezer. The batch they got was old as the mochi was hard, and didn't have that chewy, toothsome chew. 

Service was typical Asian service. Staff was cordial and timely when we asked for things though. We were the only ones there during dinner which was kinda awkward. I think if they offered delivery via Eat24, it may drive more business. I know I would order regularly if they did offer delivery. 

Good luck with parking. It can be a hair puller but we eat like old farts so we had no issues at 5 pm.
author: Cherylynn N.

description:
Gyoza: 4.5/5 - nicely grilled on one side and chewy on the other, flavorful

Pork katsu teppan (ordered spicy): 3/5 - fun presentation but katsu was a bit soggy

Ramen with chashu (+ pork belly, substituted udon, ordered spicy): 4/5 - broth on the lighter side, udon nicely chewy, skip the pork belly, was very tough

House salad: 3/5 - not super fresh, not really seasoned
author: Laurent P.

description: This place is so good! I had a miso base ramen noodle bowl, some chicken katsu, and some gyoza that were fantastic. It's a tiny bit on the pricey side, but absolutely 100% worth it. I would come back in a minute. Excellent and quick service, too!
author: Charles L.

description:
Ordered takeout at 9pm and it was ready in 15m, but the food tasted and looked like it had been sitting there for hours.
Can't believe this place has a 4/5, just go next door to Coco it's easily twice as good for the same price.
author: Jo V.

description: Been here a couple times and am really impressed. Great neighborhood spot with yummy ramen, katsu curry rice (must try!) and sushi that's really fresh too! Omg it all the things your mouth wants!
author: Chelsea B.

description: Damn Good curry and ramen! What else does my review have to say?
author: Matthew G.

description: Fumi opened a year ago and competes with Coco's Ramen which is only a few doors down. However, Coco's Ramen only has ramen for lunch and Fumi has a wide variety. You could get sushi, rice, curry, etc. I tried their unagi rice for a company's staff lunch and liked it. At $15, it's pricier than other neighborhoods with more Japanese restaurants competition. A nice addition to the Bernal Heights neighborhood.
author: Jennifer T.

description:
Came back (a week later) and we came with a large group. I talked this place up so much and when we arrived the restaurant was packed so I was afraid the service and food would come a bit short. 

The servers and kitchen were definitely feeling the pressure. However, the service was still great and they accommodated our custom orders. To be honest, the extra wait for food really worked out for us since we discovered that their SAKE selection and pricing is VERY REASONABLE. It's not like the best in the world, but pound for pound GREAT VALUE. 

I upgraded it to a 5 star rating because of the service and the hidden gem that is their SAKE selection.
author: Patrick M.

description: Every Green Curry Ramen add fried garlic: the stuff dreams are made of. Excellent vegetarian option; super flavorful, filling, warming, life affirming.
author: Nashelley K.

description: Max the owner is a really nice guy. He treats every friend as his friend. The teppan curry is awesome. Try the spicy black curry not the extra spicy one. The curry's taste is rich, round and powerful with seafood undertones.
author: Q C.

description:
I love curry. I love spicy foods. And I love this place. Having just recently moved to the city, I am blessed that Fumi is so close by. Actually it was the first restaurant my roommates and I first ate at once we were moved in! But other than having sentimental value, Fumi makes some bomb curry. 

I usually rotate between to pork katsu curry and the curry udon with chasu. The pork katsu and chasu are just alright to be honest. The best thing is very obviously the curry; I DON'T KNOW HOW THEY DO IT. It definitely has a unique taste to it that I haven't found in japanese curries elsewhere. And the best part is when you ask for spicy it is actually spicy! A+

Appreciate the condiments that they leave at the table. Those red pickled radishes are the best sides to have with curry rice. 

I'm lucky that I live close enough that I never have to worry about parking, but it is located in one of the lesser packed areas of the Mission!
author: Ellen M.

description: From the videos of the curry dishes I've seen, i had super high expectations.  Well, when your bar is set that high it usually isn't met lol.  All in all i thought everything was average from service to food.
author: Hugh L.

description:
3.5 STARS!

Dropped by on a whim as we were walking in the area looking for a place to eat but didn't wanna deal with parking in the Mission.. saw the new signage and a sign for happy hour so we popped in!

Didn't come in with any expectations considering I hadn't heard anything about this place (I read all the local food blogs, trust mehh)

We ordered:
Tempura (appetizer) - it came with 2 big pieces of shrimp and like 3 pieces of veggies. Batter was light, crisp, brown and just perfectly fried. A lot of places tend to do the thick yellow batter (yuck!) but not here. It was decent!

We ordered two entrees and I forgot what the other one was (those dranks really kicked in!) - but the hamburger teppan curry was AMAZEBALLS. It's pretty much a sizzling plate with rice topped with a hamburger patty and a bun. The curry sauce is poured upon being served. The sizzling sound is music to my ears :) UGHHH. SO FREAKIN GOOD. Why doesn't SF have more teppan places? The creaminess of the curry and rice and the running egg and the savory bite of the hamburger patty... HEART HEART HEART. I mean, you can't really go wrong with that combo...

Overall, the prices were pretty standard and the food was decent.
It's a good casual spot to visit if you're around the area but I wouldn't make a special trip. Small and clean restaurant, seems like mostly locals who pop in.
author: Emily C.

description: I honestly love this place and the ramen is fantastic. But lately service had been so horrible I have to post a review and give it 2 stars. Hope it improves because I used to be a regular but will not be coming back.
author: Kibet M.

description: This place has pretty terrible service. They forgot the miso soup in my takeout order and when I called they tried to deny it. The lady unceremoniously handed me off to her boss who also denied it. He ultimately offered me a refund but with no apology and hung up on me. The curry itself had a burned taste and the salad had no dressing-- overpriced for 10.95. Will get my refund on principle and ask for the tip I left as well-- and never go there again.
author: Jen H.

description: Delicious vegetarian ramen option. The broth is delicious! The service was ok. They didn't check on us at all and it felt a little rushed when ordering, but the food is so good, it's totally worth it!
author: nisha k.

description: Ordered the agedashi tofu, chicken karaage and pork belly tonkatsu ramen. Developed a bad stomach ache afterwards. Was hoping this would be my go-to spot in the neighborhood but now unlikely to return.
author: H S.

description: Ordered takeout. The worst teriyaki I've ever had. It was like boiled dry chicken with a tablespoon of sauce! Couldn't eat it.
author: Jax L.

description: One of my new secret (and favorite) spots. My boyfriend found this on a whim because we were both craving sushi and ended up ordering something completely different. My boyfriend usually gets the chashu ramen while I order the chicken katsu teppan curry. I'm always stuffed after the curry because they provide a pretty big portion of rice on top of an egg with a generous amount of chicken katsu pieces. We've tried the sushi (sexy mango) and it was just ok. Definitely come here if you're craving curry or ramen! Also, on the times I've visited, I've always sat next to Japanese people and for some reason that assures me that this place seems legit lol.
author: Jiwon P.

description:
New favorite spot! Had the every green curry ramen and it was delicious. Ramen portion not as big as some others but very tasty and very reasonably priced. ($11 I believe)

Service was a bit slow but friendly.
author: Teresa B.

description: Was craving Katsu and found Fumi nearby. Ordered the chicken katsu ($10) while my friend got the pork teppan for about $13 (only difference was it was on a hot skillet and had an egg). Paired with a large Ichiban beer ($6) and plum wine ($5 which was a bit sweet for my taste).  Both dishes were great. Huge portions and great prices so definitely coming back here again!
author: Lisa X.

description: I wanted ramen for dinner. These guys had excellent ramen. I got tonkatsu with pork and then some fried garlic on top, great flavor. Wait staff was kind and fast. Location was chill. Honestly at this point I'm just adding more words so Yelp will let me hit post. This is good ramen, go for it.
author: Brady S.

description:
It is march 25 2016 and this is my 3rd time coming here. If this review is too long, I'll just summarize it real quick. Food-DELICIOUS and surprisingly not too salty. Staff-Great service and very nice. I highly recommend giving this place a try.

The restaurant is smaller and intimate. The staff is amazing! They are nice and they check if everything is great. 

I have tried the curry chashu ramen, tonkatsu chashu ramen, katsu teppan curry, and the chicken katsu curry plate. The pork in the ramen was soft and flavorful! It was like it just melted in your mouth. The broths were nicely flavored and not too salty or bland like other places I've been to. The chicen katsu comes with a nice portion of chicken, curry, rice, and has a side salad. Curry was full of flavor and the salad had some cute carrots cut into a flower/star shape. I liked the teppan curry. It's served in a sizzling plate with egg, rice, katsu, and the curry is poured in front of you for that sizzling presentation. The only thing about it....is that it was sizzling, i like to dive into my food when i get it...so  needless to say i burned my tongue haha. If you got the patience, then I highly recommend it!

For dessert we tried the iced thai tea and the green tea cheesecake. The thai tea is served in a nice little goblet type glass and a bendy straw! (The inner child in me enjoys bendy straws) The green tea cheesecake was just a tad too small of a slice for but it was delicious! Sometimes they run out, the first day I came here they were out, but today they had some.
author: Nicole T.

description:
Slow service, good food - but by the time the food came out, anything would've seemed good.

Sat down - waited for menus, then waited to get our order taken, and then waited, got our drinks, and waited and waited, got drink refills, and waited and waited for food. From the time we sat down to the time food came out was almost an hour. 

My pork katsu curry ramen with a smoked egg finally comes out. The pork katsu was fried nicely - juicy on the inside, crispy on the outside. The curry ramen was just ok. The smoked egg was a perfectly done soft boiled egg, but we weren't able to pick up any hints of 'smoke'.
author: Judy C.

description:
Ramen was needed on this cold day! 

Ordered the pork katsu curry ramen, the curry was the perfect amount of spice and gave a great flavor!  I wasn't crazy about the katsu but that's partially because I had fomo over the soft shell crab that I saw after I ordered. 

Fumi roll came as an appetizer- it was warm with crab on top and so delicious. 

For dessert we got the green tea mochi and green tea cheesecake- THE CHEESECAKE IS WHERE ITS AT!!!!!
author: Christina R.

description: Solid, well prepared, consistent Japanese lunch classics. Attentive staff, and a pleasant atmosphere complete the experience. If you like Jazz standards as background music, so much the better.
author: David B.

description:
Disclaimer: I only ordered one item and had it takeaway so I can't speak for the service or anything else on the menu, although the woman who helped me was very nice when I picked up the  food. 
With that said- the ramen I ordered was AMAZING. I got the curry flavor with chicken and it was different than usual ramen but in the best way possible. I had no other add ons but think an egg would've been nice in retrospect. HIGHLY recommend. My sister had a few bites too and agreed. Will certainly be back!
author: S E.

description: Mmm... yummy. I like the Every Green Curry and I like it very spicy, which is spicy indeed. The black curry was fun but I don't think the squid ink adds much flavor to it, aside from adding color. Service is good. A nice little local restaurant worth checking out.
author: Mei L.

description: Ended up here because our usual place (Coco's) was closed. We were pleasantly surprised.  They only have one kind of ramen: tonkotsu, but it was good, you can add extras and it comes w/your choice of sides for just under $12.  My son had the chicken katsu curry which was a very generous portion and quite tasty. Gyoza was good too!
author: Teri K.

description: The food is absolutely wonderful. I had chicken katsu and a Thai iced tea. The chicken was divine. It  was cooked absolutely perfectly and the curry sauce was the most delicious gravy. The portion was well sized and filling. The Thai iced tea was also wonderful. So why three stars? The service. The service was horrible. We came in at lunchtime with a party of five. We were seated within five minutes which was great. However, we didn't place our order for another twenty. We weren't even asked for a drink order in that time. There appeared to be one waitress for the entire restaurant during the lunch rush aka highly understaffed. The people I was with said that is typical. That means it's a problem that needs to be addressed. Even having one more waitstaff would have solved the problem. Our waitress engaged in zero pleasantries, didn't offer refills, and was eager to give us our check. It is hard to want to return someplace when the food is amazing, but the service is one star.
author: Katie S.

description:
Came here yesterday in a group of 5. This place is kinda small with three tables that can seat 4-5 and a couple of tables that can seat 2. At first we were seated right by the door and it was chilly cold every time that door opened. When space opened up, we asked to be reseated to another table and they kindly obliged.

I got the tonkatsu chashu ramen and I thought it was extremely bland especially when comparing to ramen places like orenchi or santouka. The chashu was good but not the melt in your mouth kind of chashu.

Agedashi tofu: 4, lightly battered which added a nice crunch layer without overpowering the tofu
Pork katsu curry rice: yum! The pork katsu was cooked really well with a good ratio of batter to pork plus the pork was not dry at all inside. The curry had a kind of added citrus flavoring to it.
Clam miso soup: reported as delicious
Hamburger teppan curry: reported as delicious

Out of our table of five, 3 of us said it was alright but wouldn't come back and 2 of us said it was delicious and would return (those two ordered the hamburger teppan curry and the clam miso soup)
author: Mimi T.

description:
Had a busy day in the office so we decided to order through doordash. We orders 3 curries and 1 chicken teriyaki.

The food arrived quickly, hot and the katsu was still crispy! There was a mixed salad with each meal. It was pretty nasty. This was due to putting fresh greens next to hot food in a box. The greens were wilted and inedible. I would suggest putting the salad in a separate container like most Japanese restaurants do. 

The teriyaki chicken was quite dry and didn't appear to be the same portion size of meat as the curries. Definitely a place we'd order from again but will request no salad next time
author: Tiffany L.

description: I like this place tho! I got ramen for my lunch that was so good. Next time, I will try curry. It looks yummy :)
author: Pinarat S.

description: Came here on a Thursday afternoon, easy to get a seat, pork tonkotsu ramen was delicious! Not too salty, just the right amount of ramen, plenty of thick chasing slices, just the right portion. Street parking available right out the street, though it's $2.15 an hr, it was quite worth it.
author: Stephanie T.

description:
After hiking bernal heights, fumi was within walking distance. 

Very clean, friendly staff and the atmosphere was great. 

The good looks great and tastes great too. 

Everything was decently priced.
author: Fran C.

description: This is my 10 y.o. son's favorite restaurant.  He loves the pot stickers, ramen with crab and hamburger on sizzling platter with egg and curry sauce.  They always remember him and we go maybe once a month.  It's a casual joint, but the food is consistently good and prices decent.
author: Sarah H.

description:
Curry was great! We got katsu and it had egg with it which was awesome. The ramen was very mediocre which is what I'd expect from a place that served both ramen and curry??

We didn't try the curry ramen though since it didn't sound too authentic, I think that's their spec
author: Linn L.

description: Service was a bit slow; gyoza were average (and perhaps a bit too "springy"); chicken karaage was OK, but the texture felt like that kind of chicken they use in nuggets, i.e., pressed back together rather than an actual piece of chicken breast. I had the tonkotsu seafood ramen. It was good, but not outstanding. I tasted the curry flavor and that's better. I'd be in no hurry to go back.
author: Paul L.

description:
Both kinds of Ramen broth are great and the chicken katsu was like the most perfectly katsued chicken I have ever seen... go see/taste for yourself. I didn't know that every other restaurant sucked at chicken katsu so much. Will not be able to order chicken katsu at other places in good conscience now because there's just no point. I don't even like chicken katsu that much and now I suddenly see the hype.  Also, the gyoza was tasty. The chashu pork is stupid good, too.
Friendly staff and fast service. Not sure about the sushi, I didn't try it.
author: Katie W.

description:
What I got:
Curry ramen w/ chicken katsu

What I thought:
I came here not expecting much, but it actually turned out to be pretty good!

This was my first time trying curry ramen and definitely won't be the last! The broth was really flavorful and not too salty.

The chicken katsu was extremely crispy and tender. Went very well with the curry ramen.

Not sure if I just have a big appetite or if the bowl was tiny, but I felt like I could've eaten an entire extra bowl. Portions weren't the biggest, but good quality food if your looking for a decent chicken katsu place.
author: Tony V.

description:
I came and ordered the Japanese curry fried shrimp rice plate last week. It was yummy, very much satisfied my craving for Japanese curry. This place gives me a new lunch option since this place is not that long of a drive from my workplace. I ordered the extra spicy which the server told me it would be level eight on a scale of 10, and I think the description was quite accurate. I can enjoy the spiciness without burning in my mouth. It's great that the plate comes with a side of salad with some vinegar dressing.

The decor of the place looks nice too. It appears small on the outside, but I went to use the restroom before leaving I found there's a dining room in the back too. Therefore the capacity is probably what one would see in the front area.
author: H K.

description:
Have had my eye on this place for a while and now I can check  it off my list. Tried spicy pork ramen and gyoza. Ramen noodles were undercooked and pork was tender but 85% fat, broth flavor was okay. Gyoza was similar to what we have in the freezer at home. Nowhere near the quality you get in Japan or even in SF Japan Town ramen shops. Probably won't be 
back.
author: Elisa T.

description:
3.5 stars.

Nice little japanese place with friendly service and decent food quality.

They nail a lot of the little touches like the tea selection and really rich miso soup. Where they fall flat is in the quality of the curry. The curry itself is too watery and doesn't have the rich  thick texture that you get at a really top-notch japanese curry spot. Also, the tempura they served us with the curry had clearly been pre-fried and then reheated prior to serving. This would be understandable during a lunch rush at a busy place, but was not appropriate for dinner on a slow night.
author: Peter W.

description: I've only had delivery and take-out curry from this place, but their curry is oishi desu yo! Japanese curry is one of my comfort foods and the chicken katsu and fish katsu curry does not disappoint. Love how their spicy curry is actually spicy and the katsu is still somehow crispy after being put in a take out container. Can't wait to dine-in to try their sizzling teppan curry dishes and sample the black curry!
author: Greasybones V.

description: We came here on Tuesday night! It was ok at first. They first serve us two water without asking, but I wanted hot water! The ramen is ok, but it's the worst part. The noodle and the soup is kind of salty anddddddd there is a pice of plastic on ramen!!!! They offer free desert for us, but who has the mood for a desert when you just have a plastic ramen.
author: Yinru P.

description: This place was okay. I got a spicy tuna roll which I would never get again. The color of the tuna was not right and I don't know what exactly it was mixed with. the California roll was good, pretty basic but I did not like that the basic rolls had fish eggs all over them. Unnecessary to me. My girlfriend got the chicken ramen curry and it smelled so good, it was so warming and delicious. I would definitely get the ramen here, it was fabulous. Super quick service too!
author: Gabby M.

description:
Wow.

This has really quickly risen to one of my favorite spots to eat in the neighborhood. I tried to come to Fumi for the first time with my neighbor but it was closed (Monday, boooo!) and finally got a chance to try it last week. It was so good, I went back again today and realized I don't typically do that! Last time I got the Shrimp Teppen Curry and it literally came to me sizzling and delicious. This time I got the Chicken Noodle ramen with curry...holy crap, this stuff is delicious. 

What I like about Fumi is that it's no nonsense--you get some delicious Japanese food in a sizable portion for a decent price. Living in the mission I cannot tell you how many times I got to a restaurant and somehow end up with a quarter plate of slab of chicken breast with blueberries and goat cheese on it. So frustrating.

I went to Japan last year and honestly, didn't understand why people were so into ramen. Some ramen in the Kyoto train station turned me on to it and I've been looking for good ramen ever since. Now, I'm not necessarily saying this was Japan-level ramen because what do I know about that? But it was downright delicious and definitely worth your time. Love you, Fumi!
author: Sarz S.

description:
Saturday night dinner time, walking down a crowded Mission street into this cosy little place, completely transformed from the old donut shop.  The menu is katsu and curry with either rice or noodles, and whole crab done a few different ways.  They don't serve alcohol, but I overhead them saying you can bring your own.  I got a nice pot of Gen Mai cha for $1!  We split the chicken katsu with rice and curry and splurged in a whole crab with garlic and basil.  The katsu was crispy and perfectly done, not greasy.  Curry sauce was tasty, but you have to like Japanese curry which is a whole different animal from Thai or indian.  More like a curry gravy.  
The crab was pretty decent, and a fun way to spend an hour leisurely picking and slurping.  It wasn't the most amazing crab experience, but well priced for off season, and tasty.  Service was extremely warm and friendly and everyone around us seemed to be also enjoying their food. As a side note they have several kids meals that look good for $6.  A solid addition to the neighborhood.
author: Nicole B.

description:
I went here for lunch the other day and was pleasantly surprised. It's mainly a curry place, but they do have some crab and noodles if that's what you're into.

I ordered the chicken katsu with curry over rice which was good. The chicken katsu was perfect so I was pleased. I ordered "spicy curry" which I didn't think was very spicy at all, maybe my spice level is a lot stronger than most. The actual curry flavor i thought was a bit vinegary.

My biggest con was that the curry got cold quick, and the worst thing in the world is cold curry. With that said, I'm not sure what the restaurant could do besides serve burning hot curry. D ordered curry on a hot plate instead which was curry rice with egg over a hot plate. The hot plate kept the curry hot throughout the menu, would definitely get that instead next time.
author: Jessica H.

description:
As a vegetarian I have found it difficult to find a ramen place that has fried tofu (I am not a fan of raw tofu) so I was extremely happy to find this place and to find that they also have a curry option for broth. I got the every green noodle with curry and I am in love! I will definitely be going back here to satisfy my ramen craving! 

I also tried the matcha mochi ice cream and it was amazing!
author: Carissa B.

description: The best ramen broth... I tried ramen for the first time here, it ruined me for anywhere else! Both the curry and tonkotsu broths are amazing. I crave this curry ramen all the time. They play classic bossa nova music too, love it!
author: Eva D.

description:
I had never really been exposed to Japanese style curry until my friend took me here. he was in the states for a few months from Japan and told me of all the places he had been in SF, this was definitely the most authentic and made him feel a little less homesick. 

well, I can say that I loveddd the food here! it's really fresh and served STEAMING hot. if you don't like spicy food I would recommend getting your spiciness as mild. i would consider my own heat tolerance pretty high and the medium is more than enough for me.
author: Alyssa L.

description: Ramen is good here as is the hamburger steak. Skip the desserts, seems store bought (Costco frozen cheesecake?) if you can handle spicy, don't even other with the mild.
author: Long C.

description:
We came here on a Sunday afternoon and it was surprisingly quiet since the food was pretty good!  We tried the curry ramen with pork katsu and the tonkatsu ramen with chicken katsu.  Both types of katsu were fried well- not too greasy and nice and crispy.  The curry ramen was good and not overly rich and heavy as other places I've tried.  The tonkatsu broth was also light, but still rich in flavor.  If you prefer heavier, fatty tonkatsu broth, you might not appreciate this style as much, but I did think the pork and garlic flavor was still pretty good!

We'd definitely go back to try their curry teppan dish, which they're supposed to be well known for.
author: Denise C.

description:
Had a good experience here couple days go.  Place was clean, service was fast, and the food was pretty good!  

I liked the garlic flavored edamame and clam in sake sauce, both I would recommend since I haven't had those else where

Parking could be a problem, and right now space is limited (place was packed most of the time when I was there on a Wednesday at 7pm).
author: Bo Y.

description:
I ordered the Chicken Katsu ramen curry and it was really tasty. Ramen noodles with curry instead of broth and the chicken on top. Paired with a house-made Thai iced tea and some green tea ice cream at the end. Delicious! 

Food came out quick, the wait staff was exceptionally nice and attentive and the location is spot on. A wonderful addition to the neighborhood!
author: K. C.

description: I have been on a ramen kick so have been checking out as many places as possible, especially in my neighborhood, and I have to say this place has grown on me. To be fair, it was great the first time I went, but my ramen quest started after an exceptional broth and noodle experience in San Jose so I am a tough cookie. I did the standard tonkotsu ramen and it was delicious, but not noteworthy. I then did the curry ramen with pork katsu and it is definitely noteworthy. I have to say though, and this is a huge compliment, that I can never finish a portion and the leftovers taste even better. I am a fan from the noodles to the broth. Have been back and will continue to be a patron.
author: Laura B.

description: Came here on a Friday night and there was no wait (they had a few empty tables that filled up by the time we left), and was pleasantly surprised. Fast service and very attentive. I ordered a spicy curry ramen with pork katsu - the soup was like a thinner version of their curry and the katsu was lightly fried and juicy. Would definitely come again for a quick bite.
author: Ada C.

description:
I've gotten ramen a couple times, always to go. 
I'm no expert, but it's tasty to me, and they're quick and polite.
author: Charlie H.

description: The vegan everything green with gobo ramen is so good! Will come back and try the vegan rice plate curry.
author: Joshehann W.

description: Fumi is by far the best Noodle place ever! My stomach melts and my tongue sizzles with each bit. Haha I'm serous that's how delicious it is. Max and the staff are awesome! I've gone almost since I heard of them over a year ago and recommend all my coworkers and friends to it as well. I'm just hoping and praying they open a Fumi in the East Bay. Maybe call it 'Fumi Twice'
author: Susanna B.

description: Do not get their sashimi/nigiri! It's not very good, bland, not tasty, and seems like its basically just old frozen fish. I got the 12-piece for $26, tasted pretty bad, that I didn't really want to eat it. The other people in my group ordered curry rice, and seemed happy with it.
author: Geobio B.

description: My boyfriend and I went here on the recommendation of a friend who said the curry was delicious. And it was! I got the vegan chicken katsu curry and boyfriend got the pork katsu curry. We both really liked our meals. My only complaint is the wait staff. I asked the waitress if they made their vegan chicken in house and I was also curious to know generally what was in this fake chicken. Before I could even ask about what was in it..she cut me off and told me "I don't make the food so I don't know." And legit..somewhat ran away from me after giving me that terrible answer (and we went on a weekday when the restaurant wasn't very busy). ok....what if one of your customers had a severe allergy to something? To be clear, I don't but a lot of people do. Another waitress told me the curry was vegetarian but I'm not sure if I have that much confidence in anything they say now. I believe the wait staff should be familiar with the menu as well as the chefs. As someone who has some restraints with my diet, I appreciate when the wait staff is knowledgeable because it shows that they actually care about their customers. But..the food is tasty so I'm torn.
author: Margaret Y.

description:
So much for National Noodle Day! Worst ramen ever. Completely flavorless! The Top Ramen packages are 10X better. Save yourself the money (and the calories)...go to Coco Ramen instead, if you're in this neck of the woods.

(10/18/16: There's no place to publicly respond to the owner's comment, so I'm posting it below)

Hi Max, Thank you for your response. I can be more specific if you'd like. First off, the only reason why my cousin and I chose to try this place was because the name of the restaurant on Yelp is "Fumi Japanese Curry & Ramen." We found this to be misleading because the name outside the actual restaurant is "Fumi Japanese Curry & Seafood." Anyway, we both ordered the Chicken Katsu Ramen, hers was spicy and mine was mild. The broth was so flavorless, we could (not) even finish half of it. It tasted like water. The chicken katsu was pretty bland and dry, too. It was also a little disappointing that some of the items that are normally standard at other ramen places, like the brown egg, are an additional charge at Fumi. Again, had we known that ramen is not a specialty at your restaurant, we wouldn't have ordered it. Hope this message is more thorough.

Cindy
author: Cindy O.

description:
The space is new and clean, but the dining area is fairly small.  The kitchen appears to be twice as big.  I wouldn't come with a group larger than 4.

I've dined in and gotten take out, and the food has been consistent so far.  The takeout order of curry with fried shrimp seemed massive to me.  The teppan hamburger curry was tasty but the sauce was thicker than I prefer. Tintin liked the curry ramen.

Service was good and prices were average for the area.
author: Seong P.

description: First visit. Great service, lovely decor. Seating is a bit crowded -- this place is very popular. We arrived shortly after opening and the front room was already full. By the time we left, it was packed. We ordered the large sashimi platter; portions were generous, incredibly fresh. We each had a ramen bowl with pork; both the cutlet and the roast pork were great. We will be repeat diners!
author: S R.

description: Okay... so SURE the other items on the menu are good, but I'm just going to save you some time looking at the menu. You really only have one option.. the Teppan Curry. Actually, there are 5 or so meat options, so I guess you have a few. But for realz, Japanese curry over crispy rice, meat and egg on a sizzling hot plate. No joke, I've been here 5 times this month. AND 5 people responded to my Snapchat because it looked so good. Score!
author: Jennifer N.

description:
Oh we were so hopeful. 6:15 arrival on A Saturday night with a party of seven. We were the only ones in the restaurant and they started to fill up after we were seated. First of all they charge you a dollar 50 for a tiny cup of tea which is typically complementary everywhere else. Server eventually  brought a teapot so that the 6 of us could have refills. Staff was very nice. Our order was taken and then we waited. We received 3 appetizers in a timely manner. Yakitori, hamachi Kama and salmon sashimi with "salad". 3 yakitori skewers. Two takoyaki and a Kobe sausage. The octopus the was very hard and the sausage and was equivalent to three anorexic little smokies. Exact same flavor. 

Salmon sashimi $12 for 5 pieces and garnish!! Expensive!! And Just ok. Then we waited and everyone around us was being served. We inquired and they said soon. Other people getting food but not us. 7:20 and our 4 kids are crumpled and starving. We ask for the bill. They beg us to stay and apologize profusely. they admit there was a screw up food coming soon. We try to leave and they promise it's coming. They stated they were new, there was a mistake with the order and the food was almost ready. The server was very apologetic and genuine. She tried to explain to the kitchen why we're leaving and they argued with her. She was caught in the middle. We agreed to wait and within a few mins the food came... But food was wrong. Sent it back and just asked for the bill. They promised a discount and could we please wait. They were so kind but kindness only goes so far. Food came back correct but so bland and portions for the ramen were so small. We left hungry. The bill came and the discount they offered covered the tip. They are very nice but have so much to work on. Wish them the best of luck but we won't be back. Sorry no pictures. Wasn't worth it.
author: Elaine S.

description: The Curry is just as fire as Stephen. Both in spice and in goodness. You feel me?!!!!!!! Fumi Japanese is a spot hidden in your belly. It's the urge that tells you, "Hey bud, I think it's time we get some great Ramen or Curry. Fumi?" Me to belly: "Fumi!!!!!!"
author: CJ A.

description: After seeing a snap of the sizzling teppan curry we had to try it. We wanted to try different things so my wife order the Pork Katsu Teppan Curry & I tried the Soft Shell Crab Ramen. While I did enjoy both, I would definitely give the edge to the curry. The katsu was nice and crunchy...until I sauced it with the curry! The ramen broth and noodles were good as well, although I didn't care too much for the soft shell crab (surprisingly). While not a large restaurant, we didn't have to wait very long to be seated and once we were the service staff was excellent.
author: Ritz D.

description: Been a regular since this place started. Love the friendly staff and enjoy my staple order of Fish Katsu Teppan Curry.
author: Ali Z.

description: It's hard to find ramen that mimics the taste of the ramen you can only find in the small hole in the wall ramen shops in the heart of Shinjuku, but THIS was it! Kind and fast service was appreciated. I ordered the Every Green Curry Ramen and there were so many layers of flavor, it was delicious. The tofu was the perfect texture and the spice was perfect. Definitely coming back :)
author: Nai M.

description: I tried twice in past 3 weeks and food was okay and price were too high. My friend and I spent $90.00 for Dinner with one bottle of beer. Service was very slow
author: JJ w.

description:
My first ramen experience was at Fumi's. While I ordered the chicken, the pork ones ordered with the ramen and the udon were simply superb. the experience was wonderful with the staff being helpful and efficient. 

The ramen, being my first time, I had not benchmark to compare it against, but being the first experience it has created a very high bar for other ramen :). They have an interesting collection of ramen, burger and curry and sake. They also had some really nice green tea. 

The restaurant was neat and the open kitchen allowed one to see the cooking of the food. Yet, it was nice not to have the smells of the kitchen come into the restaurant area.
 
What was pleasant was that after we finished our dinner and were enjoying our sake, the staff were in no hurry to see us out of the door and actually said "enjoy your drink". 

I'm a fan and will visit again! 

Service - 5/5
Ambience- 4/5
Value for Money - 4/5
Visit again - 5/5
Recommend to a friend - 5/5
Overall - 4.5/5
author: Madan M.

description: My friend and I get Fumi every Sunday night. She always gets the Katsu Chicken Curry Rice and I usually get the Katsu Chicken Ramen (Curry Flavor). It always hits the spot, and we're always looking forward to it each week. Do yourself a favor and go check this place out, definitely get something with the curry sauce in it, or just get the sauce on the side.
author: Charlie V.

description: How does a curry restaurant run out of rice at 630P? 4 of our party of 6 were served their entrees while the other 2 were told if they wanted to eat now with the rest of the group, they'd have to switch to brown rice; they didn't really have an option. We ordered a bottle of sake and as it was a rainy night in San Francisco, asked for a recommendation for a warm sake. Our bottle was brought out with half the sake warmed in ceramic sake bottles. "Let me know when you are ready for the 2nd half of the bottle, and we will warm it, too, " said our server. When we were ready for the 2nd half, after asking 4 times, it finally arrived when we were almost finished with our meal. "I forgot about it and left it in the microwave" was the response.  Food was decent but the service, haphazard at best.
author: Rich S.

description: This review is for the Japanese curry. My favorite Ramen place (coco's) is up the street and so I pass by Fumi all the time. And one day decided to poke my head in. And was astonished at how good the curry was.
author: Collen H.

description:
I came here with a friend of mine on a Friday night around 8:30p. it was pretty empty inside with just 2-3 tables filled, so we were seated pretty quickly. I got the curry ramen with chicken katsu (extra spicy), while my friend got tonkatsu ramen with chicken katsu (spicy). 

while noodles and chicken katsu were good, the curry "soup" (more like sauce) was hella heavy so I felt like I was eating like a lo mein kinda dish. I was bit disappointed in the amount of vegetables given also because it seemed like it was just a dash of everything. 

spice-wise, my friend and I were underwhelmed. we were both kinda like "I thought we said spicy or extra spicy..." I added the red spicy powder that they have on each table, which helped a little, but I wish it had been extra spicy like mentioned on the menu.
author: Victoria N.

description:
Decided to try this place out since it replaced what used to be Eagle Donuts.  Came here around 7 and the place wasn't packed but it had people inside. It's pretty small inside, fits about 20ish people I want to say. The remodel wasn't bad, compared to what it used to look like. Anyway, onto the food.

Shared the chicken karage. The karage wasn't bad, was actually probably my favorite dish of the meal. Hot, moist, and flavorful... yum. Shared the pork katsu curry over rice, medium spicy. The curry wasn't flavorful, but it wasn't completely bland. It needed more curry to flavor everything, especially since you're eating it with rice. If you eat it with the rice, you lose the curry flavor. The pork katsu wasn't bad, crispy and was pretty flavorful. We also got the beef curry over noodles. The curry sauce was pretty bland with the noodles. It was pretty bland when I just slurped the curry sauce too. Some of the beef pieces were tender while others were chewy... I'm not sure how that happened. Both the spiciness levels need to be worked on too... there was no kick to it either. We even ordered a very spicy curry over rice for someone to go and they said the very spicy wasn't even spicy! So either they forgot to add the spice or they need to add more! Overall, the curry here was... average. Kind of runny, which probably explains why the sauce is bland. I'm probably happy with making curry at home out of a box. Maybe it was grand opening jitters... but I think they can definitely improve the flavor for the curry. Service is pretty good, place is clean, and parking can be a hit or miss in the area.
author: Johnson S.

description: I love this place! Reminds me of Japan, all the decor is very modern and elegant and the workers are very nice and polite. I got the tender beef curry ramen and tried a bit of the chicken katsu rice plate and both were delicious. The spicy level was perfect and all the meat was cooked really well. Highly recommend :)
author: Angela K.

description: Came here on a Friday night around 7:30, and surprisingly it was half empty. I ordered the Chicken Katsu Udon an and it was really good. The server was also extremely friendly.
author: Guorui W.

description: This place is the best! The teppan curry is out of this world. Some of the best ramen I've had in the city. The waitstaff is always very friendly and attentive. Can't say enough good things about Fumi!
author: Eric D.

description: Curry is authentic. Waitress is super sweet. One drawback is the background song. It is so sleepy. Would recommend the place to change the song:)
author: Aim-on S.

description: This is a cool little spot, very nice inside and very great customer service. Love coming here during my lunch breaks
author: Mona Lisa L.

description:
Ed U. sums up the curry review well.  Hubs and I were excited about this place opening. Not having to go to Japantow made me hopeful. 

The clam miso was terrible. No dashi, just hard boiled miso. It shouldn't look like it's going to be gritty. Overcooked, chewy clam. I only ate one and was proud of myself for not spitting it out. 

The curry was decent but nothing I'd pay for again. The pork katsu was bland, pounded flat and not crunchy.  The curry tasted like they made it with a curry block (not a particularly good brand).  It had the spice flavors but no umani or the hint of sweetness you expect with Japanese curry.  I'm pretty sure I make a better katsu curry so I guess I'm eating at home the next time I want Japanese curry.
author: Mona M.

description: Service was super fast and the waitress came by to pour more beer and sake for us every once in a while. The tonkotsu broth wasn't aggressively thick which was nice, and the noodles were delicious. The calamari was a little under salted but the sauces on the table helped that.
author: Maureen L.

description: The food here is tasty!  My friend and I shared a mixed green salad and the spring rolls to start...  I had the seaweed salad and pork katsu udon (she had the seafood udon).  YUM!!  The matcha cheesecake was delicious, too.  The decor is very nice and the ambience is super relaxing.  The owner Max is very friendly and always has a smile on his face.  Our server (I didn't catch his name) was very attentive, pre-bussing our plates and kept our water glasses full.  There is a back room for larger groups/private parties.  A delightful experience.  I definitely recommend this place and will be back.  :)
author: Alisha G.

description: The server was lovely and extremely attentive. She worked that dining room with elegance and grace. The hygiene of the place was outstanding. The Kirin was cold and they have the large bottles. The curry, I ordered extra spicy, wasn't as spicy as I prefer. No shakers of spice-it-up on the table. The katsu pork was as one would expect from the photos, not authentic. But the server was really lovely.
author: Stanley J.

description: Nice service, good food. Their chashu is nicely crunchy along the edge but soft on the inside. Their eggs can softboiled as well. Their spicy level is a bit safe; I ordered a Very Spicy and it was at most a medium.
author: Topher C.

description: It's a very nice new Japanese restaurant. I'm not a Sushi guy so I ordered the regular Teriyaki Chicken and the appetizer, Shrimp and Vegetable Tempura. The food was very tasty and very nice presentation. However, I dropped two star because after spent almost $20 bill and I was still hungry. The portion was very small.
author: James L.

description: This place is solid and having a solid Japanese curry spot within walking distance of south Noe Valley is a dream come true. I ordered the noodles and curry with tender chicken and a side of veggies and it was everything I wanted in a casual lunch. Ramen noodles were perfectly QQ chewy and the "spicy" spice level definitely has a kick. My husband got the mild pork katsu rice plate which came with a little salad on the side. Rice was also perfectly cooked and chewy - pork wasn't blow your mind like what we've had in Japan but it was crispy and tender. Our dishes came within five minutes of ordering which was great because we were so hungry. Service was super polite. Will be back often!
author: Stephanie L.

description: Delicious ramen and delightful ambiance! I wandered into this establishment on a quiet Saturday evening with a party of six, and was immediately seated at a nice table in front. I ordered the pork katsu curry ramen and it was delicious! Tried the gyoza and tempura appetizers as well, which were great. Highly recommended!
author: Laura B.

description: All the products were fresh and the dishes had the warmth of home-made Japanese Curry. The chefs take great care in selecting the best quality ingredients. The restaurant also caters to all tastes, including vegan and vegetarian options. The service is not only prompt, but also friendly, and most importantly, genuine. The flavors and pricing are phenomenal and I recommend this place to everyone I know. I love this place! I go at least 3-4 times per week. I live very close by! Enjoy!
author: Joey I.

description:
To be clear, this review is mostly directed at the owner / non-existent management. I've been in the restaurant industry my whole life and have managed multiple restaurants. I never leave 1 star reviews when it's not warranted. Here's the breakdown:

Let's start with the good. Food: good.  If you are deciding to eat here based on the food, go for it! I honestly liked the quality and taste of the food. 

Service: Good-bad..or gbad. 

Let's start with the good: Their attentiveness was great (we were one of two tables in the restaurant). 

The bad: And this may not be their fault, but they apparently have no authority to replace wrong items. When ordering ramen you pick the soup base, ingredients, then order the spicy level. I ordered curry, pork, then spicy. The thing is they have 2 types of pork - Chashu or Pork katsu aka Tonkatsu pork. This may have been an oversight on my end by not specifying which one. However, the server did not ask clarification but rather assumed which one I wanted. Fair mistake on both our parts, fine. So out comes the order. As you can guess, it was the wrong pork. I politely said it was the incorrect one, can I please get the correct pork. The server responded that they could add the Chashu (for an additional charge). I said "no, sorry, this is not what I wanted." They refused to replace the pork. I then asked to speak to a manager. Their response, "We do not have a manager here." 
I replied "Okayyy.. Can I speak to the owner?" 
"Sorry, the owner is on vacation."

I seriously have never experienced this in my life. If a customer ever came to me and said, "this is not what I ordered," I would immediately replace it, no questions asked. I have advised my staff to do this immediately if this were to happen to any customer. Sure, sometimes it's the customer's fault... SO WHAT!! You replace it!  You replace it to keep your customer happy so that they return!

So basically they refused to replace the pork, no manager or owner there to correct this or try to amend the issue, the servers have no authority (apparently) to correct this mistake, and really, this would have been the easiest thing to fix. 

There's more details to the story but for the sake of not writing a novel, these were the cliffnotes. Honestly, please get a manager and have that manager present at the restaurant and/or properly train your staff to deal with these situations.
author: Ryan O.

description: Hamburger curry rice is really good. My son likes his teriyaki as well. Everything is fresh and authentic!! Good family restaurant.
author: Fion S.

description: Came here for dinner on a Saturday night, there was no wait. I ordered their curry ramen and it was amazinggggg. I really like thick creamy broths, so the thickness from the curry was just perfect! I think I got the chicken katsu as the meat option.. it was either that or pork katsu... Which ever it was, it was perfectly done. YUM! Also, staff was very attentive and friendly, that's always a plus.
author: Lina C.

description: New favorite place in the world. Get the Hamburger Teppan Curry, amazing.  And curry ramen... What?!  So good.
author: Bernard W.

description: I love the curey here. I think it's one of the better places for curry outside of Japan
author: Deepankar K.

description: Really fantastic curry. Great drink selection (loved the iced milk tea), nice environment, the food is spectacular.
author: James M.

description: A new ramen and curry restaurant appeared in our neighborhood, so we have been wanting to check it out. Our backgrounds are Asian American with ancestry in China and Japan, FWIW. I saw the softshell crab ramen on the menu and had to try. It is hard to find softshell crab, and it is a delicacy where I am from. Others in my group ordered curry rice and tonkotsu ramen. The restaurant is nicely appointed, modern trendy vibe, pan Asian, but not Japanese. Service was prompt and courteous. Dishes looked beautifully presented and in a manner that we usually see when we go to Japan (no piles of raw greens or veggies that don't historically exist in Asia such as tomato!). My softshell ramen seemed tasteless. The broth was soy sauce based ('shoyu ramen'). I couldn't quite figure out what was missing. It was salted well enough, but it was as though some ingredient were missing (MSG? kelp? No idea). the softshell crab was crispy, but also tasteless. I sampled a bit of everyone's fare, too. Curry rice was ok, with a hint of heat, but it tasted like the kind that comes out of the box--something I could easily whip up myself. For those with food allergies, the server did mention that the curry mix included peanut powder, so maybe those with peanut allergies should take heed. The tonkotsu ramen was also flavorless, even though the broth had the right milky consistency. The tonkatsu was served on the side, which is a good thing when they do that, because the tonkatsu (the fried pork cutlet, not to be confused with tonKOtsu, the pork broth in which the ramen is served) gets soggy if served on top of the ramen and the eater is slow. Oh, and I got the runs a few hours after I left, although my dining partenrs were fine, so I don't think I will be ordering the softshell again.
author: 和子

description: I just went there with my girlfriend tonight, I've tried curry noodle! It's so dame good! My girlfriend order pork katsu curry on special tappan, I like curry, especially japanese curry. But this place I give them 5 star cause their food is good and services friendly with impartial price. Will be back,
author: Louis C.

description: THIS PLACE GIVES ME LIFE!!! The service was excellent! Everyone was so sweet and attentive! The Ramen here was everything I've been looking for in San Francisco!! So amazing, I will absolutely be back here over and over again!
author: Tiffany L.

description: Pork Katsu Teppan w/ curry sauce was delicious! I will come back here to try other menus.
author: EunJoo C.

description: This is a good way to get some Japanese style curry. I wonder where the cook learned how to make this or if it comes from a curry mix.
author: tomohisa w.

description: I was looking for a tonkatsu ramen place, but stumbled upon Fumi Japanese Curry House. I've never had Japanese curry ramen before but it was delicious. I'm not a big curry fan, but Japanese curry has fewer spices making it less offensive to my palate. I ordered the pork katsu ramen. The pork cutlet was nicely breaded and very flavorful on its own. My only complaint is that the curry broth was high in sodium. Less salt, please.
author: Howard H.

description: Ordered both a curry plate and Ramen and they were amazing. I lived in Japan for 4 years and can honestly say this is the closest Ramen bowl I have had that taste authentic in the city.  Very delicious curry as well with a great presentation. The staff were amazing. They delivered our food within a reasonable time despite it being busy. The restaurant is clean and the prices are reasonable. It's 11 dollar for a Ramen bowl vice the usual 12 or 13 other restaurants charge.  DEFINITELY GIVE THIS PLACE A TRY!
author: John U.

description: Convinient location, modern clean restaurant. I came here with a group of friends. I was glad they were not busy because i was very very hungry. I ordered ramen curry with chicken katsu - just the right amount spice and flavor. My friend ordered chicken teriaky and spring rolls, he was ok with his food, said nothing spectacular. Staff is pretty helpful, casual atmosphere, and pretty good food that is not expensive - i will come back here again to try other items on the menu.
author: Brook R.

description: Very nice curry. probably 1st or 2nd best in SF.  Japanese curry is not only one kind, Kuro curry, and other special curry.  I recommend this place for Japanese curry fun. it was so delicious.!
author: Elli S.

description: Best meal I have had in a long time.  Vegetarian curry ramen was so good I cant stop thinking about it.  Garlic edamame was also fantastic.
author: Debra T.

description:
This place was amazing. It was the best chicken katsu I've had so far. It was small and cozy, and the service was very friendly! 
Definitely recommend!
author: Atzay P.

description: Really liked the chicken katsu, very crisp with good quality meat, and curry was yummy. Curried chicken was tasty. Kid's meal is a fantastic deal, with fruit, rice, protein, and salad. Curry fried rice was just ok, a little bland. Have to take down one star for service (fast and friendly, but server forgot things or they were out), but I'm hopeful that'll improve. Many restaurants have uneven service their first few weeks as they work out kinks in their processes. I've been twice and hope to go again soon.
author: Jen P.

description: The ramen here is excellent. Also tried their pork katsu teppan curry and would recommend it.
author: Suraj C.

description:
The big question in my mind was, of course, how this would stack up to Muracci's. Not quite, but very close and close enough to nail four stars.

Of course I had the curry. They have two vegetarian curries in addition to several with meat,  fish, or seafood.
