I ordered spicy, which I expected to be medium given the choices of mild, spicy, and extra spicy, and it was, about similar to Muracci's medium. The "every green" has tofu, carrots and broccoli. The default is fried tofu. I asked for un-fried and that's what they did and it was good. Nice they have a brown rice option, too. I'll be back to try the vegan chicken (gobo root). And curious about the curry noodles as well. Anyway, the curry sauce was good enough that I soaked up the generous portion with the remaining rice.

The one fish item was deep fried. It would be nice if they had a grilled option for the curry, though it looks like they have that in the teriyaki version. I'll ask next time.

Also got a side of steamed veggies, which was mostly broccoli and pleasantly al dente.

The print on the menu is small, so if you need reading glasses, bring 'em along. They also have a blown-up menu without pix in the front window before you enter.

Do let them know if you want the curry sauce vegan if you're not getting the vegan curry.
author: Charles B.

description: We ordered the veggie ramen, pork katsu and a kids meal. We ordered spicy and everything had a lot of flavor. The service was wonderful too. I think this is better than Muracci's downtown.
author: Jesse W.

description: Quite underwhelming. Mediocre noodles and rice. Curry was lacking flavor. Service felt rushed at times
author: James K.

description: Don't get the sashimi here. It cost me $26 for 10 pieces of Sake. The curry is pretty good and worth the price.
author: Ruha D.

description: I'm not a huge fan of curry but all my roommates wanted to go. It's DELICIOUS. The chicken katsu curry was really good. We also got it with the ramen noodles and it was surprisingly good. Decor is clean, service was really nice, would definitely go back again.
author: David D.

description: Yummy Japanese place that specializes in curry. Although the katsu curry rice dishes are great, consider trying the curry udon- really warming and hearty! Service is good although the location is sort of out there (unless you live in the deep Mission)
author: J L.

description: Solidly OK Japanese curry. Definitely satisfies my craving when I want some Katsu curry, but it's nothing special. The curry is a little on the looser (more watery) side, but the flavors are there. The pork katsu is good though.
author: Stephen C.

description: I had the hamburger and egg sizzling curry plate, and it was GREAT. I'm usually not that into hamburger, but this one was excellently flavored. In SF there's few Japanese curry options, so I'm happy this place opened up!
author: Brian R.

description: Service and food were both good. Worth a try. I went there for curry pork katsu over rice, pumpkin soup and Asian crab salad. They have different spicy levels, so if you want to try other level of spiceness.
author: A C.

description: I have to say this is a welcome addition to the neighborhood. Never had Japanese curry before and it was surprisingly good. Not that I expected it to be bad, but in my mind curry is a little played out and is sometimes a miss. Fumi, on the other hand is worth a try! Their curry is rich and complex and the right amount of spicy. I ordered the curry with vegetables and tofu over noodles and it was the perfect solo dinner. The restaurant is warm and inviting and the service was efficient and polite.
author: Leslie H.

description: The pork katsu was on point. Good atmosphere and friendly/attentive service - worth a stop if you're craving Japanese curry.
author: Andrew C.

description: $2.50 for iced down tea with NO FREE REFILL! Tender Chicken Curry had something they tried to pass off as chicken. It was slimy, fatty & some pieces couldn't be cut. Awful, will never go back there.
author: Claire B.

description: Stumbled upon this place one Sunday evening. We got the back area to ourselves. The staff are very friendly! The food is tasty!
author: Joseph P.

description: Loved it! Got the pork curry. The rice was perfect and everything tasted great. Will definitely be coming back!
author: Jeff C.

description: A lovely coworker suggested this place, and I'm glad I went.  Mind you, I haven't been to Japan (not yet), so I don't know what I'm missing.   I had the ramen with curry (spicy) with chicken katsu, and it was delish!  I found the restaurant to be rather charming too.  Give this place a try! :)
author: Adisa K.

description: Seafood noodle curry and Thai ice tea hit the spot for a casual lunch. Nice addition to the neighborhood.
author: Adrian F.

description: Super-friendly, tasty neighborhood Japanese place. We tried a noodle curry dish, sashimi, and a kids' meal, and all were delicious. The service was fantastic. We brought two little kids, and the staff seemed legitimately happy to take care of them. Very fair prices too, like $10 for chicken katsu curry noodles in broth.
author: John Z.

description: my boo thang  got the curry beef ramen noodle. nasty he says. i got the udon noot curry with beef. gross. It tastes like a gas station meal. My boo thang asked for beef with no fat. he got nothing but fatty pieces. curry sauce itself saves the whole meal. they need to shut down the resturant and use the remaining investment into bottling and selling sauce it would make the more money than the mediocre dishes they serve, he says "im over it" as he closes the box.
author: Chenea P.

description:
we tried this place for lunch and were underwhelmed
i has the curry soup with seafood which and although it had several clams there wasn't much of anything else. the curry tasted just ok - i asked for mine hot and it was but very little flavor.  also they didn't offer any thing to wipe my fingers with not even more napkins and after opening the clams m
y hands were a wet mess. the other order was the same only with steak which was tender according to my wife but we probably won't be going back. we really wanted the place to be good since it was so different from the other great japanese restaurants in bernal heights - but it was just so so.
author: jaime r.

description: Great customer service. Food was delicious. Curry was amazing. I had the pork katsu yeppen and it was fantastic.
author: Grumps H.
